story:
We've received inquiries from backers wondering if X6 can feature USB hub functionality. When looking into the internal PCB layout and structure, there is limited room to add components to make this happen. However, our engineering team worked very hard to modify the circuit for compatibility with a hub module and re-arranged the whole PCB layout to accommodate the additional hardware. And thus the new X6 was born.

 

The new X6 comes with USB Hub mode (compatible with USB 2.0) that provides data transfer functions over its USB ports. When you connect the USB-C Hub port to USB-C port of your device, you can seamlessly charge your device as well as sync and manage your files with 2 USB-A ports between USB-C HUB port.

Double press the power button, and X6 will enter USB hub mode, displaying the "H" icon. Double press again to turn off USB hub mode.

The new X6 utilizes the GL850G USB 2.0 Hub-Charger Controller, which is Genesys Logic’s advanced hub solutions, and which fully complies with Universal Serial Bus Specification Revision 2.0. Its IC's are widely used in high-end consumer electronics including the Sony PlaySation. With a switch to select between power bank mode and USB Hub mode, it is simple to activate USB hub function while minimizing power consumption.

 

 


 

 

USB-C Power Delivery technology allows devices to be charged at speeds previously unimagined in USB power supplies. X6 from Zendure provides up to 45W PD output, which means some of your favorite gadgets get the same or even better performance from X6 that you’d expect from their native chargers.

For instance, X6 charges the iPhone 8, 8 Plus or iPhone X 300% faster than their original chargers, using an Apple USB-C to Lightning cable (not included with X6).

 

X6 has an industry-leading 45W USB-C PD input & output. Despite its 20,000 mAh capacity, it can recharge itself in 3 hours if using a 45W PD charger, the fastest in the industry.

With 20,000 mAh of charge storage, that 3 hour fill-up can get you pretty far.

 

Most power banks on the market have one problem in common: they all have a minimum output ranging from 80 mAh to 150 mAh. Smaller devices, especially wearable devices, usually draw less current than that, causing a power bank to automatically shut off.

X6 is the only USB-C power bank on the market that can charge an almost unlimited range of low-power devices such as smart watches, Bluetooth earphones, fitness bands, and much more. 

It's a great feature for the people who loves the outdoors, and have a lot of wearable devices to charge.

 

 

Simply press and hold the the power button for 3 seconds, X6 will enter X-Charge mode, and display the "X" icon. Press and hold  again to turn off X-charge mode. Now your wearable devices will never run out of power again in the wild.

 

Another common problem with current power banks is that you cannot use them to power or charge other devices while the portable charger itself is being charged. Even some of them do, there's a short interruption of power when it enters the pass-through charging, causing the devices being charged to reboot and lose the data.

Taking X6 one step further, we upgraded pass-through charging to include a UPS feature. There is no power interruption when X6 switches between pass-through and battery mode, making it ideal for applications such as security systems, micro-controllers, home automation, network storage, back-up power for Wifi-routers, and more.

X6 even provides full-power output in pass-through mode and is not limited to the amount of input power provided. This allows you to charge X6 with a solar panel or dynamo while still getting maximum output performance.

 

X6 is the only USB-C PD power bank that has 5 outputs, allowing you to charge up to 5 devices at the same time. The more, the merrier, isn't it?

 

X6’s Digital LED Display lets you know exactly how much power is left.

 

With high quality hardware components and an advanced safety system, X6 provides unparalleled protection to keep you and your devices safe.

 

Convenience was a top priority in the design of X6. In order to provide ample room to access to all five charging ports and the LED display while avoiding wasted space, we arranged the six lithium-ion battery cells in a 2x3 configuration. This also provides an ideal profile for carrying by hand or stowing in a bag. In addition, we consolidated all of X6’s features into a single button for ease of use.

Since X6 is capable of so much more than traditional power banks, it’s going to be seen in more places. Appearances matter, and no effort was spared when it came to X6.  The artful blending of curves and gentle ridges are in keeping with our recent Passport Travel Adaptor, whose design and features earned over seven thousand backers.

Lightest 20,000 mAh PD Power Bank (Smallest, too.)

By streamlining structural and electrical engineering, we have made X6 the lightest and smallest 20,000 mAh power bank on the market with Power Delivery, reaching the highest energy density among competitors. (See comparison chart below for details).

 

 

 

The Zendure 63W 4-port USB-C PD Charger is the perfect companion for X6. It features 1 USB-C port, 1 Quick Charge 3.0 port and 2 USB ports with Zen+. Charge your X6 or New MacBook and up to 3 other devices all in one place at the same time. The USB-C output delivers 45W power to recharges your X6 in just 3 hours. With 3 universal plugs for US, UK and EU,  you can enjoy a quick and convenient charge anywhere.

 

 

 

 

Zendure is a team of passionate consumer electronic engineers and designers. Our team members come from companies such as Apple, Huawei, Sennheiser, and Oppo, and have many combined years of experience in the field of consumer electronics.

Our mission is to continue to design and innovate classic and reliable products to improve people’s lives. Our vision is to become the leader and best employer in the high-end consumer electronics market.

Since 2013 we have earned our reputation by first delivering the Zendure A-Series crushproof external batteries, and then Passport, the world's first travel adapter with an auto-resetting fuse. 

X-Series is our new line of power banks and chargers that represent the latest charging technology in the market, with X6 being the first to debut in the family. We've listened to feedback from hundreds of thousands of our customers and fans worldwide. Adding features to X6 that no other companies would do, such as X-Charge™ and UPS features. It's designed for our customers, each and everyone of you. We can't wait to share this product with you, and that's why we are on Indiegogo again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Having successfully launched two Kickstarter projects (the Zendure A-Series portable chargers, and the Zendure Passport). In the past few years, we have learned a lot in designing, prototyping, molding, and manufacturing of high-end consumer electronics. In 2015, we established an R&D office in the Pearl River Delta in China, the heart of manufacturing for electronics. Hired project managers, purchasing managers, engineers, and quality control personnel to oversee the whole process. Thus, we have more confidence in delivering a high-quality product. However, the risk still remains when it comes to a complicated project like X6 since we are using the world's most advanced and latest technologies. There's still unpredictability in terms of manufacturing. We will maintain constant and friendly communication to all of our backers as usual, and do our best to ensure the success of this project.

 

FAQ

1. Which countries or regions will X6 ship to? How much will shipping cost?

X6 is free to ship to mainland territories of the United States, Canada, Australia, United Kingdom, several European Union countries*, Singapore, Japan, China, Hong Kong and Macau. For the rest of the world, please enter your country at the checkout to check the shipping fee. Please note that all VAT charges, if any, shall be paid by the backers.

*Germany, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Luxembourg, Netherlands, the Republic of Ireland, Portugal, Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden

 

2. When will X6 be shipped?

X6 is expected to start shipping in June 2018.

 

3. What does it come with?

X6 comes with a travel pouch, a Type-C to C cable, a user guide, 18-month warranty from the date of purchase, some free travel-related stickers, and friendly Zendure service.

 

4. Can X6 charge my laptop?

Yes, it can, as long as your laptop has a USB-C charging port and uses USB Power Delivery(PD) protocol.

 

5. Can I take X6 on an airplane?

Yes, it can be with you in your carry-on luggage. The capacity of X6 (20,100mAh / 74.4Wh) falls within Federal Aviation Administration’s safety limit.

Please click this link for more detailed information:

https://www.faa.gov/about/initiatives/hazmat_safety/more_info/?hazmat=7

 

6. Does X6 support pass through charging? (Charging a device while being charged)?

Yes, X6 even provides full-power output in pass-through mode and is not limited to the amount of input power provided. This allows you to charge X6 with a solar panel or dynamo while still getting maximum output performance.

 

7. Can I charge X6 with a solar charger?

Yes, you can, as long as the solar charger provides a 5V power supply via USB-C.

Compact solar chargers aren't the fastest way to charge X6, but given enough access to direct sunlight, the two will get along quite nicely. Take charge and go green!

 

8. What are the safety features of X6?

Right from the start, safety has been our top priority with X6. The intelligent control unit inside X6 is capable of protection from over-charge, over-discharge, over-current, over-temperature and short-circuit.

 

9. Are the internal 18650 Li-ion batteries replaceable?

X6 is not designed to be taken apart, nor are its components designed to be removed, modified or replaced.

We've listened to feedback from hundreds of thousands of our customers and fans worldwide. Adding features to X6 that no other companies would do, such as X-Charge™ and UPS features. It's designed for our customers, each and everyone of you. We can't wait to share this product with you, and that's why we are on Indiegogo again.      Risks and challengesHaving successfully launched two Kickstarter projects (the Zendure A-Series portable chargers, and the Zendure Passport). In the past few years, we have learned a lot in designing, prototyping, molding, and manufacturing of high-end consumer electronics. In 2015, we established an R&D office in the Pearl River Delta in China, the heart of manufacturing for electronics. Hired project managers, purchasing managers, engineers, and quality control personnel to oversee the whole process. Thus, we have more confidence in delivering a high-quality product. However, the risk still remains when it comes to a complicated project like X6 since we are using the world's most advanced and latest technologies. There's still unpredictability in terms of manufacturing. We will maintain constant and friendly communication to all of our backers as usual, and do our best to ensure the success of this project. FAQ1. Which countries or regions will X6 ship to? How much will shipping cost?X6 is free to ship to mainland territories of the United States, Canada, Australia, United Kingdom, several European Union countries*, Singapore, Japan, China, Hong Kong and Macau. For the rest of the world, please enter your country at the checkout to check the shipping fee. Please note that all VAT charges, if any, shall be paid by the backers.*Germany, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Luxembourg, Netherlands, the Republic of Ireland, Portugal, Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden 2. When will X6 be shipped?X6 is expected to start shipping in June 2018. 3. What does it come with?X6 comes with a travel pouch, a Type-C to C cable, a user guide, 18-month warranty from the date of purchase, some free travel-related stickers, and friendly Zendure service. 4. Can X6 charge my laptop?Yes, it can, as long as your laptop has a USB-C charging port and uses USB Power Delivery(PD) protocol. 5. Can I take X6 on an airplane?Yes, it can be with you in your carry-on luggage. The capacity of X6 (20,100mAh / 74.4Wh) falls within Federal Aviation Administration’s safety limit.Please click this link for more detailed information:https://www.faa.gov/about/initiatives/hazmat_safety/more_info/?hazmat=7 6. Does X6 support pass through charging? (Charging a device while being charged)?Yes, X6 even provides full-power output in pass-through mode and is not limited to the amount of input power provided. This allows you to charge X6 with a solar panel or dynamo while still getting maximum output performance. 7. Can I charge X6 with a solar charger?Yes, you can, as long as the solar charger provides a 5V power supply via USB-C.Compact solar chargers aren't the fastest way to charge X6, but given enough access to direct sunlight, the two will get along quite nicely. Take charge and go green! 8. What are the safety features of X6?Right from the start, safety has been our top priority with X6. The intelligent control unit inside X6 is capable of protection from over-charge, over-discharge, over-current, over-temperature and short-circuit. 9. Are the internal 18650 Li-ion batteries replaceable?X6 is not designed to be taken apart, nor are its components designed to be removed, modified or replaced.

story:
Hello Backers,

We want to give an extra boost to our crowdfunding and without your help is it not possible. So please ask your friends and family to join our campaign to make it a success.

To give you an idea what we will do with the money, here an overview of the planning

$ 10000  Design and making a dedicated P.C.B.

$ 20000 Tooling for the metal parts

$30000  Mold for the PC parts

$40000 Beta testing and getting the safety certifications

$50000 Design and production blister, sales and marketing tools retailer

Since March 31 we also  have made our first deal with an OEM party where we can start to supply  coming December. This was only possible thanks to you backers, you showed them that there is a market for this cool lock. So together with you and  OEM clients we can make a solid foundation  for the future. 

Why is life so much easier with a RE_LOCK?

*KEYLESS ENTRY  You know how handy this is with your car ,so why not your bike 

*ALARM   80 decibel tone will inform everybody that they want to steel your bike.

*LOG  FUNCTION  Always proof to your insurance company and the police that your bike was locked in case of theft.

*LOW ENERGY  Thanks patented electronics the standard batteries (2XAA) will work for more than 3 years.

*FUTURE PROOF   Blue-tooth technology enables us to update your lock with the latest software in the future.


Re-Lock, the bicycle lock that makes all other bicycle locks redundant

Unlock your bicycle hands-free with Re-Lock, a revolutionary bicycle lock with an electronic key. You keep the e-key in your pocket or bag. And that’s where it stays. As soon as you get to your bike, the key and lock “communicate” with each other radiographically to check whether they match. If so, the e-key transmits a unique, unbreakable code to the lock, encrypted within a radiographic signal. The lock shoots open within a fraction of a second. The key has not moved from its position. You almost feel like James Bond. But how exactly does it work?




It works as follows: the e-key is activated by an encrypted tone sent via a radiographic signal, which then sends its unique code to the lock. The lock checks whether the code is a match and if so, the lock opens. If not, it remains locked securely.

The lock and key switch off after every action, thus saving energy so that the batteries last you a long time.




The e-key does a great deal more besides: It always registers the latest status of the lock. Is the lock open or closed? Handy to check, and particularly handy if your bike has been stolen. That way, you can prove to your insurance provider that you locked your bike. The lock is smart, it knows when it needs to carry out a certain action and then switches to sleep mode: saving energy! You replace the battery every three years and the key – being smart – warns you in good time.



But first: the catalyst

On a rainy summer’s day I, Chiel Bekker, was sitting on a covered terrace. As usual, bikes were parked everywhere around the terrace. A woman with a large bag appeared. Once she got to her bicycle, she only found the bicycle key in that bag after quite some time searching. She needed both hands to open the lock and had to put her bag down in the wet street. She eventually climbed on her bicycle drenched from the rain.


                    

Shortly afterwards, a man with an umbrella approached and he too first had to search hard for the key while balancing the umbrella. After a few failed attempts to open the lock with an open umbrella in his hand, he gave up. He had to close the umbrella, he got wet in the rain, unlocked his bike, opened the umbrella again and cycled off. The next victim was a young woman who walked to her bike while talking on her phone. Sheclamped her smartphone between her chin and shoulder, searched for her key, and tried to open the bike lock with both hands. Slowly but surely, the phone slid out and crashed onto the pavement.


                 

                 

The concept and its development

As an experienced industrial designer and product developer, I thought ‘There has to be a better way. Why are there no bicycle locks that open automatically when you are an arm’s length away from your bike, for example?’ That notion remained on my mind and after an extensive search on the internet, I came to the conclusion that no such product existed yet. How is it possible? There are all kinds of locks you can open with your smartphone or fingerprint, but even then, you still need to use your hands.

In collaboration with mechanical engineer Richard and electronics engineer George – with whom I have already been working for twelve years – I started developing the concept. This super handy bicycle lock is the result of those efforts. It’s hard to understand why this has not been thought of before.

                                                  

                                          


What is next?

We have established a crowdfunding initiative in order to produce this amazing Dutch Design product. The lock will be certified so that you can be sure it meets all requirements. It is also constructed in such a way that it is fully recyclable at the same product level. Re-lock will be ART2 certified, this is accepted by all bicycle insurance companies.

                                                        


You can register now for one of these awesome locks at a Super Early Cyclist price. Hurry, because only the first 100 submissions will qualify for the Super Early Cyclist rate.


A brief timeline of what we have already done and what we are still going to do:

September 2015  Concept design

October 2015  Feasibility tests on various electronic configurations

November 2015  Development of mechanics for the housing and design

December 2015 Design of electronic “sleep” mode to extend battery life

January 2016  Proof of concept durability testing

February 2016  Debugging and fine tuning of electronics and mechanics

March   2016  Start crowdfunding

April/May 2016  Certification

June/July 2016  Field testing

August 2016  Production preparation

September 2016  Production

October 2016  Commence supply


We need 50,000 euros to start production (which will take place in the Netherlands). Because although RE-Lock might look simple, it contains a great number of electronic and mechanical components. On the images below you can see exactly what is involved. Production tools need to be made in order to produce everything.

If we exceed the target amount, we will use those funds to develop additional cool gadgets, like a “find your bike” functionality, which helps locate your bike in crowded bike storage facilities, for example.


                 

                 

What we need & what you get

We need your support to realise start of development and production Re-lock, in return we offer your the follow perks:

  

                              


We are here to make your life easier


Although Re-Lock is a young company, its management team has years of experience and a great deal of expertise in the field of product development, marketing and product launches.

Last year (2015), a team of three technicians devoted themselves entirely to the product development of the Re-Lock bicycle lock and that resulted in this incredible user-friendly, convenience-enhancing bicycle lock. Together with users of the bicycle lock, we aim, where possible, for continual improvement of the product with the input we hope to receive from users.

Another important aspiration is to develop and produce the product in the Netherlands: DUTCH DESIGN AND QUALITY.


FAQ (Frequently asked questions)


Why an electronic key rather than simply using your smartphone?

1) Smartphones regularly have an empty battery, which would mean you then couldn’t open your lock.
2) Wi-Fi and Bluetooth signals are not at all secure and can be hacked from great distances.
3) With a smartphone, you have no proof your bicycle was locked for insurance purposes.
4) In rural areas, there are still many places with no or poor reception, leaving you high and dry.
5) You would not be able to lend anyone your bike without giving them your phone too, which is of course not very practical.
6) With a smartphone, you still need to undertake an action to instruct the lock to open, meaning you still need your hands to open the lock.


How long do the Re-Lock batteries ( 2XAA ) last?

At least 3 years with intensive use.

How do I know when the batteries are almost flat?

As soon as the batteries produce an insufficient charge, you receive a beep signal in good time.

Can the lock close spontaneously while cycling?

No, the lock uses manual resilience by means of a child-safe lever. The electronics can only open the lock by means of an encrypted radio signal from the e-key.

What happens if I forget to lock my bike?

If the bike is unlocked, you get a signal (sound or vibration) as soon as you are over a meter away.

Does the lock work in all weather conditions?

Yes, the lock withstands cold, heat waves and heavy rain very well because the electronic components are completely enclosed.

                               

                                                

             

For our dutch friends, how to pay:

(met credit card)
Choose one of the Perk's at the right top of this page, and follow the steps:


www.Re-Lock.eu

story:
Our Story

After 2 years of development, we've finally launched the iOS and Android versions of DrinkMate, the smallest breathalyzer in the world. DrinkMate is the next iteration of breathalyzer technology and we've made it affordable!

We believe in simplicity and convenience. Plug DrinkMate into your iPhone, click the automatic prompt to download our app from the app store, and simply blow into the end.

Have an Android? Download the app and plug in your DrinkMate. The app will automatically open and off you go!

Your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) is then displayed right on screen. Quick, easy, and shareable.

The Vision

Technology is not the reason people make poor decisions after drinking- it’s psychology. If someone wants to make a mistake after drinking, like driving, they’re going to find a way to do it if they’re alone. If their friends are with them, however, either physically or digitally, peer pressure can be used in positive way to make safer choices.  

DrinkMate and its app fundamentally change the image and goal of breathalyzers. Its design inherently draws in friends and people around you to see what you’re doing in a friendly manner. If your friend keeps blowing a high BAC number, can you really just sit there and let them make a mistake? You can’t - you’re forced to help them make the right choice. The more people who know how much they’ve had to drink, the safer a group is as a whole.

How is DrinkMate different?

DrinkMate's physical design, internal circuitry, and hardware/software interface are patent pending and completely new. We're proud of this and here's why:

  • NO battery! DrinkMate is powered entirely by your iPhone or Android.
  • NO mouthpieces! Our air inlet at the end of DrinkMate is designed to slow and direct air perfectly to our sensor so that readings are accurate without direct contact (germs... eww!).
  • NO re-calibration! We compute BAC in a fundamentally different way than pre-existing breathalyzers so that DrinkMate is minimally affected by sensor changes over time. Our proprietary algorithm has been developed over months of testing, tens of thousands of DrinkMates, and updates for sensor age effects in its operation.
  • 100% of DrinkMates (yes- every single one!) are individually programmed, tested, and calibrated using a custom-built machine that we shipped and installed in our factory.

Specifics

  • Our sensor manufacturer has created a brand new high-quality sensor for us and utilizes specialized quality control measures of our design. This new sensor is more accurate, robust, and has a quicker recovery time in between readings.
  • Accuracy is approximately +/- 0.01% BAC at a BAC of 0.02%.
  • We set the maximum BAC in the app to 0.20% BAC. Any higher and you probably would not be able to stand!
  • DrinkMate is held securely in place by the iPhone Lightning connector or micro-USB port for Android devices.

Global Community!

Design Status - DONE!

  • Hardware: COMPLETED! This was no easy task, but our hardware is finalized! Apple has very stringent and specific rules for all aspects of hardware that touch an iPhone. We are officially registered with Apple's MFi program and our factory is MFi-certified. Extensive time and effort has gone into making the iOS DrinkMate and we are proud to say we comply 100% with Apple's requirements.
  • Enclosure: COMPLETED! Tooling is not only designed, but finished and in production. We made some internal modifications to our existing Android DrinkMate enclosure so that the iOS DrinkMate will be accommodated as well. This is tremendous and eliminates much of the risk associated with manufacturing hardware products and the associated plastic injection molded enclosures.
  • iOS & Android apps: COMPLETED! We have completely re-designed the original DrinkMate app and are looking forward to showing off the new User Experience, Interface, and exciting features!

The Core Team

Compatibility

  • iPhone 5, iPhone 6, iPhone 6+ (DrinkMate uses the Lightning Connector)
  • iOS 8.0 or later
  • Android phones with USB hosting capabilities
  • Android 4.0+

Special Thanks

Carpool - our wonderful filming location!

Zach Griffin, Zack Gross, Scott Jeschke - video production  

Eric Stenmark - video production & editing

Drunk Mode App for iOS & Android - media outreach, partner

Fulfillrite - best shipping & handling service in the world

Rachel Couch - photography and product shots

Kristen O'Callaghan - packaging design

Sculpteo - the best 3D printing services available

Andrew Ziegler - Manufacturing & Marketing Consultant, Brand Builders Group

Mahmoud Lababidi - data scientist

Kyle Boult, Greg Lipschitz - international sales

Jose Lopez-Sanchez - legal consultant

story:
In daily life, we cannot live without two things. One is a mobile phone, and the other is a wallet.

 

We hope to design an ultra-thin wallet that will hold your commonly used cards and cash and serve as a stand so that your phone has the best angle of use in various usage scenarios.

 

This is NuWallet.

 

You can attach it to the latest iPhone 12 magnetically. We have also introduced a sticker version so you can stick it on the back of any phone.

 

It has 2 pockets and can hold up to 5 cards. You can also combine freely, including dollars, coins, etc.

 

It is foldable and supports 3 viewing angles: 75 degrees, which is easier to unlock for Face ID and the best angle for Face ID; 35 degrees for watching videos more comfortable and 25 degrees, very suitable for use when using a calculator.

 

NuWallet can not only be used with iPhone 12 and Case with MagSafe, but it can also be attached to a refrigerator and magnetic car holder.

 

Thanks to the built-in 38 magnets that correspond to the iPhone 12, it has a super magnetic force. Even turning the NuWallet upside down, the phone will not drop.

 

The thickness is only 6.5 mm with a variety of colors ranging from yellow, blue, green, and brown.

 

Proof of working prototype that is ready for production

 

The following unedited single-shot video demonstrates a fully functional pre-production NuWallet. Testing items include:

It has 2 pockets and can hold up to 5 cards.

It is foldable and supports 3 viewing angles.

 

Specifications

  •  Materials: PU leather, Microfiber
  •  Color: Yellow, Blue, Green, Brown
  •  Dimensions: 105 x 64 x 6.5 mm / 97.5 x 64 x 6.5mm
  •  Weight: 369g / 460g

 

About Us

Nu + _Problem_.

New problems occur all the time.

Sometimes, we have to bear the problems forever.

To solve the problems, sometimes we make things more complicated.

Nu + _Method_.

We want to provide a new method that solves a problem in a simple and elegant way.

We spent a lot of time thinking, discussing and experimenting to figure out the best method.

These are the reasons why we produce new products slower than other companies and why we can make a difference.

This is NuPhy.

story:
CamTag is a set of glue-free and reusable privacy stickers that help you protect your privacy by covering the cameras on phones, tablets, laptops and desktop computers.

Privacy. We don't want to think about it but we all know it's important. We have a right to privacy, that’s why we lock the bathroom door and use passwords.

As convenient as our phones, tablets and laptops are, they can be hacked and the built-in cameras activated without our knowledge, allowing us to be viewed and recorded without our consent.

With most of us working from home these days and frequently communicating via video chat, it is more important than ever to protect our privacy now.

Facebook's CEO, a former FBI-director and many others have already made a habit of covering the cameras on their devices. And so should you!

I searched for a product that would allow me to protect my privacy by disabling the cameras on all my devices but wasn't satisfied with what I found. The options I tested were either too permanent, bulky, generic or device specific.

I wanted individually designed reusable camera stickers that fit perfectly on my phone, tablet, laptop and desktop computer.

So I designed CamTag. 

 

CamTag is a set of glue-free and reusable privacy stickers that help you protect your privacy by covering the cameras on phones, tablets, laptops and desktop computers.  

 

 

CamTag is:

  •  glue-free and can be moved aside or removed without leaving residue 
  •  reusable an unlimited number of times
  • a set of 25 stickers that come in 5 sizes to fit on the built-in cameras on phones, tablets, laptops and desktop computers 
  • available in 25 beautiful designs 
  • customizable with your own design or branding 

 

 

Each CamTag is printed in the highest possible resolution and vibrant colors.

 

 

 

 

 

CamTags are glue-free and allow for easy removal and unlimited reuse.

 

CamTags fit on all phones, tablets, laptops and screens equipped with a built-in camera.

 

The packaging folds to a square with the same height as your credit card so it easily fits in your wallet or pocket.

 

A CamTag set contains 25 privacy stickers in 5 sizes.

 

All CamTags will be equipped with a transparent protective layer to make them even more durable and ensure they look great even after heavy usage. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We will send a survey to the email associated with your Kickstarter account on June 25th using the CrowdOx pledge manager system. You will be able to choose your designs, order extras and provide your shipping information at that time. If you change addresses before we ship your rewards, you will be able to access your survey at this link anytime after June 25th.

 

 

 

 

Volker Lobmayr is the founder and designer of tabtag – glowing and reusable MacBook stickers – based in Vienna, Austria. In 2014 he successfully launched this design product via a Kickstarter campaign that got funded at over 200%. Since then Volker has been running tabtag full time, building an extensive design collection and manufacturing custom branded tabtags for companies all over the world. In 2016 he launched opaque tabtags optimized for the new MacBook models that are no longer equipped with a glowing apple logo. 

 

Visit tabtag to learn more. 

 

glowing vs. opaque tabtag

 

 

 

 

 

Thank you!

 

I'd like to thank each of you for your support and feedback on CamTag. 

Special thanks to: 

  • Roland Thurner for making the Kickstarter video. 
  • Simon Schennach, Ulli Schölfinger, and Eva Gruber for their great feedback and continued support.  
  • Faye Wheeler, Joey Robinson, Konrad Holleis, Gonzalo de la Asunción, and Bernhard Lobmayr for their corrections and suggested improvements for this campaign. 
  •  Digitalstore for providing me with equipment for the video shoot.
  • Johannes Cech, Victor Tibo, and Patrick Diem for offering the opportunity to shoot the video in their amazing office space.

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

 

In any project there are risks, however, it is our job to make sure we minimize these risks for our backers.

Since our first successful Kickstarter campaign in 2014, I’ve been designing and shipping products all over the world. We give our best to fulfill orders on time and in line with our high-quality standards.

We produced and thoroughly tested our prototypes, but there is always a chance that something unforeseen happens. I’ve been working with an experienced team of printers, we are using the highest available resolution and we dye-cut with less than 0,1mm tolerance to make sure all designs come out perfect.

We hope to deliver all rewards on time, but know there is always room for unexpected things to delay our schedule. As a supporter, you will be getting updates on a regular basis and will be informed when a later arrival of your reward is anticipated. We are committed to overcoming any given challenge and are excited to get CamTag into your hands.

Thank you for your support as we bring CamTag to life!

story:
Wekey Pocket is the thinnest and lightest foldable keyboard in the world. While existing foldable keyboards are over .39 in. thick when folded, Wekey Pocket has a thickness of under .24 in.  That is slim enough to carry around in your pocket.Typing is intuitive with a key layout designed to nearly mirror the standard PC keyboard. Compatible with tablet or smartphone, meet the gold standard for portability in the keyboard world: Wekey Pocket! 


How is Wekey Pocket so darn thin?? Well it's because Wekey Pocket is the ONLY keyboard to feature a wearable PCB (printed circuit board)! This circuit board that is bendable, foldable & squishable makes Wekey Pocket the slimmest keyboard in the world. 



Extremely Portable: With its foldable design, Wekey Pocket is incredibly compact when folded measuring around 6 inches. However, when opened it is over 12 inches making it over 80% the length of a standard keyboard allowing for ample key space. With a thickness of under .24 inches and a weight of 3.5 oz., Wekey Pocket is meant to be carried around whether it be in your pocket, bag or purse. 

Intuitive Layout: With a QWERTY layout, Wekey Pocket will feel nearly identical to typing on a standard PC keyboard. Designed to fold out at a lengthy 12 inches, there is ample space between keys to avoid your fingers from feeling cramped together. 

Typing Feel: Wekey Pocket emits a familiar clicking sound to keep your typing experience as similar as possible. While keeping Wekey Pocket incredibly flat, we also took into consideration button feel to provide feedback to your fingers. 

Powerful Battery: Wekey Pocket has a powerful Li Po 200mA battery that allows for months of use without recharging. With a full charge, Wekey Pocket can be used for over 2 months when used for an average of 2 hours per day. 

Water Resistant: Wekey Pocket is water resistant to withstand against coffee or water spills. Use Wekey Pocket worry free against such common accidents. 


Special Keys: Wekey Pocket is equipped with special keys to be uniquely compatible with your mobile devices. Find a list of a few of these special keys below: 

  • Camera (Selfie): Fn + F2
  • Home: Fn + Esc
  • Mail: Fn + F6
  • Video & Music Controls: Fn + F7 (Rewind), Fn +F8 (Play/Stop), Fn + F9 (Forward)
  • Connect Bluetooth: Fn + P
  • OS Selection: Fn + A (Android), I (iOS), W (Windows)











O/S Supported


Devices Supported


Language Layouts

Japanese


 

NOTE: Certain countries require a tax for receiving products. 
Wekey cannot be responsible for such taxes.

story:
Laptops are extremely versatile but ergonomically they’re not ideal. The longer we spend on them, the more we hunch over them, causing pain in our neck, shoulders and back.

 

 

 

 

EU-friendly! See FAQ at the bottom for more details.

 

 

 
The Tiny Tower is a beautifully crafted, portable and height adjustable laptop stand that can be used to create a really comfortable setup .. in the café, in the office, at home or wherever you are. 

  

 

 

We know that everybody is different, so the Tiny Tower adjusts your screen quickly and easily to the right height for you to work comfortably. Simply change the height at the push of a button. Over 3" (8cm) of adjustment is available through 10 different height settings.

 

 

The Tiny Tower folds down in under 10 seconds into a compact unit that's easy to carry with you. To create the ultimate mobile workstation, use it with the Tiny Tote — our high quality zipped nylon pouch that carries your Tiny Tower, keyboard and mouse.

 

 

Own a Tiny Tower in a colour that matches your laptop .. or your style! As a crowdfunding only special, you can buy a Tiny Tower in Classic Silver, Space Grey, Rose Gold and Gold. We don't intend to make to multiple colours available when the Tiny Tower hits retail shelves .. so make sure you get one now.

 

Aluminum is the main material used in the Tiny Tower because it's both lightweight and strong, making the Tiny Tower very stable. Your laptop will sit on a special non-slip polymer made by 3M to firmly secure your laptop. We've sweated the details like this to make sure you have a lasting product. The Tiny Tower feels great in your hands and even better on your desk.

 

 

 

The Tiny Tower has a smaller footprint than your laptop, freeing up more desk space. 

 

 

Your laptop will sit on a special non-slip polymer made by 3M to firmly secure your laptop. The Tiny Tower can be used with the fingers concealed inside the arms or extended for added security. It's your choice.

 

 

The Tiny Tower will reliably support both Windows and Mac laptops 11" up to and including 15”. 

The Tiny Tower is truly versatile and can be used at a standing desk (please note that it's not designed to replace a standing desk or worksurface).

 

 

 

The Tiny Tote is a custom designed carry pouch made to hold your Tiny Tower, wireless keyboard and mouse. There's also room for other items like your headphones and spare batteries. The Tiny Tote is constructed with a quality nylon outer shell and has a lined and padded inner divider to ensure that nothing gets damaged. The Tiny Tote is available separately.

 

 

The Tiny Tower comes in a beautiful bead-blasted and anodised aluminum finish in silver and black. Plastic components are made from quality engineering grade composites that are strong yet light at the same time.

 

 

When we designed the Tiny Tower, we wanted to create something that would provide superior ergonomics and also look great in any workspace.

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

 

 

Over the past 18 months, we have constructed seven fully working prototypes. Each time we built a new one, we aimed to remove complexity whilst improving functionality and ease of use. We worked hard to ensure The Tiny Tower offers super simple height adjustment. It works just like the extendable handle on checked travel luggage. We also knew that to have it fold into a compact and lightweight unit is important, allowing you to take it with you and protect your posture whenever you work. 

 

We've travelled to Asia several times and collaborated with multiple suppliers to finalise our manufacturing plans. We are ready to build the tooling required for large volume manufacturing. We are confident and excited. We believe we're further down the development path than most hardware projects that launch on Indiegogo.

 

 

Production, Assembly and Packaging are complete. Tiny Towers are now SHIPPING!

 

We couldn’t be happier with the way the product is looking and working. We have individually tested the height adjustment button and mechanism on every unit made successfully! Further detailed checks were performed by other team members, and all have been approved, assembled and packed.

 

Some shots of the Tiny Tower on the production line - as well as the finished product in the full range of colours.

 

Tiny Towers packed, stacked and wrapped and ready for shipping.

 

 

 

The Big Tiny Co is a Sydney-based hardware company led by Matt Cramsie (right) and Anhtai Anhtuan (left). We’re passionate about beautiful design, flexible working, and health and wellbeing. We believe that superior ergonomics and great design should go together.

Matt has over 15 years experience designing products for Australia’s leading furniture companies. His products have earned him an Australian Design Award and several design awards overseas. The Tiny Tower is his most personal product and he is very proud to launch it on Indiegogo.

Anhtai has built a 12 year career in product management and technology. He has a Masters in Management and is responsible for operations, making sure that quality made Tiny Towers roll off the production line and get delivered safely to your doorstep.

Origin of the Tiny Tower

The original idea of the Tiny Tower came about when Matt suffered a serious disc herniation in his neck combined with numbness down his right arm in 2014. At the time, Matt was constantly hunching over his laptop, which added a significant load on his neck.

Many existing solutions to raise the height of your laptop don't offer the trifecta of functionality that is needed: height adjustment, portability and an attractive design you'd be proud to use. So being an award-winning industrial designer who is obsessive about ergonomics, Matt decided to create the Tiny Tower to fill that gap.

 

 

FAQ

1. EU-friendly: what does this mean?  

For EU backers in selected countries, you will not need to pay extra customs, duties or taxes. Your pledge is final. No nasty surprises!

The selected countries are Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and United Kingdom.

story:
The Hub, a not-for-profit creative technology lab in Lesotho, Southern Africa is fundraising for a Wireless Network Storage Drive.

The context: Morija, Lesotho

The small town of Morija is one of the leading educational centres in Lesotho, Southern Africa. Nearly 2,000 children attend its two primary schools and two high schools. 25 other primary and high schools are located within a 10 kilometre radius of the town. However, the young people living in this town (both in-school and out-of-school) face numerous challenges:

·  Until recently, the town has had no public internet access, library or community centre. This means that young people have had no access to valuable online resources.

·  There are very few places in Morija that offer a positive social and learning environment.

·  The majority of young people in the town come from very poor families, and are desperately looking for employment. However, in a country where an estimated 30-40% of young people are unemployed, job prospects are slim and most young people struggle to find work.

·  The opportunity to receive training and practice on digital media equipment is only available to university students, or through private colleges in Maseru. Until recently, these facilities have been beyond the reach of most young people in Morija.

The Hub: a new creative technology lab

The Hub, a new creative technology lab in Morija, seeks to directly tackle these challenges. Officially launched in August 2015, The Hub provides affordable access to computers and the internet to people living in Morija. Thanks to generous sponsorship from two local donors - the Vodacom Lesotho Foundation and Standard Lesotho Bank - the project is equipped with seven laptops, six digital cameras, one HD-digital projector, a printer/scanner/copier, a range of audio equipment and access to high-speed internet. The primary target group of the project is young people between the ages of 16-35, who can make use of The Hub’s online resources to help them with schoolwork, revision and research projects. The Hub has already begun to offer basic computer skills workshops, and in the near future will also offer digital media training workshops on a range of subjects, including photography, film making, creative writing and web design. The Hub operates on a membership basis (annual membership to The Hub costs a minimal fee of M100, less than $8). Members have full access to computers, the internet and all workshops. The project is a purely not-for-profit enterprise, seeking to provide people in the community with access to information and with a range of skills that are in increasingly high demand by employers.

The Hub is fundraising for a 10TB Wireless Network Storage Drive

The Hub urgently needs a Wireless Network Storage Drive for our work and upcoming projects:

·  We currently do not have enough space on our computers for the large project files that will accumulate from digital media training workshops and from the creative work that our members will soon start to produce.

·  We only have seven laptops, and 40 members (a number that is growing fast). Our members move around from laptop to laptop depending on the availability of workspaces, and therefore do not have continuous access to the same laptop.

·  We have already begun to store on each individual computer a range of educational videos and material. However, storage space for such material on each laptop is limited.

·  We need a central data storage device that can be easily accessed by all our members. A 10 TB Wireless Network Storage Drive will provide us with extensive and easily accessible data storage space for project work and educational videos and material. All of The Hub’s computers will be connected to the Drive: our members will be able to access the files and information on the drive at any time. Members will also be able to save ongoing work onto the Drive and access this work at a later stage from any one of our computers.

Specifically, we are fundraising for the following 10TB Wireless Network Storage Drive, available on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/WD-Cloud-EX2-Pre-configured-featuring/dp/B00I2P82CS

We would appreciate any donation, great or small, to contribute to our fundraising goal of $574.

If you would like further information about The Hub, or would like to support the project in other ways, please visit our website, our Facebook page, or send us an email: thehub@morija.co.ls.

Thank you!

story:
Update

We are inviting those who interested to be included in Elite team and get the first prototype

What gamers say about us...

"Very good initiative, all you need for breath taking gfx!"  - Mike Lensen aka Amnesys -

"I really hope that I could be able to help 360HDMI because I know it can be put in store shelves like GameStop, EBGames, Best Buy, etc. Also would be cool to be part of a business that is basically by gamers for gamers!" - Joe Binder -

"This is rather sudden, caught me off guard to be quite honest! But I hope that I can lend a hand to help." -Golden Burr-

see here for more...

 

Xbox 360 HDMI - Wii HDMI - Playstation 3 HDMI Cable

Are you a gamer?
Are you fed up with playing with a “High Definition Graphic” game… then realize it’s fuzzy and pixelized while you play it? Getting dizzy too.. ?

There are hundreds of commercially available “branded” cables out there that say that they can solve these problems.  A lot of big branded gaming cables that costs a fortune to own, but really, you are only paying for the brand.

Are their products really innovations or normal cables with a name stamped on it?really worth it?

 

No need to ask these questions!

Give us 5 minutes and we will show you the real gaming experience !

 

WE HAVE WHAT YOU NEED... WE HAVE DISCOVERED A NEW TECHNOLOGY THAT WOULD CHANGE ALL OF THESE

By researching the best ways to improve gameplay and trying out hundreds of products… we have found a new and innovative way to solve all these problems.

Through rigid testing and countless interviews… we finally have the perfect product.

 

INTRODUCING THE HD-360 PLATINUM GOLD HDMI CABLE… THE ANSWER TO GAMER’S PRAY.

Here we are, discovered a cable that can maximize your gaming experience. It is specifically designed for gaming console. It optimizes graphic quality in gaming, deliver faster speed and much more...

Our team designed our cable to be at par with features and quality to any of the famous branded (and quite expensive) premium cables (such as monxxxter cable, audixxxuest, etc), but with MORE… features specially for gaming. 

 

As a bonus, and because we want our technology to reach everybody and not only the elite… with a better cable than anybody else can offer, we are planning to offer ours at a retail price that is only half the value of premium cables in the market.  Why do this?  Why the low price?  Because we think that every gamer deserves to experience their “perfect game”. After all, this is the main reason we develop the cable, we want to have something especially for gaming but with affordable price.

We also believe that the product will also perform excellently on the rumored Xbox 720 with code name “Durango” (http://www.ign.com/wikis/xbox-720).  There are not much leaked info on this project to faithfully test our product on it, but based on our development team, the cable will still perform at its best and will still be the best cable even for the upcoming Xbox 720.  We always develop for the future to assure our users that our technology will always be on top and will never be obsolete.

Moreover, in trying to develop the best cable, the product will also work best on the latest blu-ray or DVD players or other HD video players in the market.  The product is also HDMI version 1.4, which will play all 3D formats.

 

YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR GAMING EXPERIENCE

Simply change your boring old cables to our state of the art gaming HDMI cable and experience all of these in an instant. Imagine yourself experiencing the war environment of Call of Duty: Black Ops 2, or being mesmerized by the view while standing on top of a tower in Assassin’s Creed 3.  Feel like you are really playing the game in NBA 2K12 and FIFA 13… drive like you have no tomorrow in Forza Motorsports 4.

Based on the trials and interviews, 100% agreed that our product is better than all the commercially available cables that we tested against.  We were better in price and quality, and unanimously agreed that they would rather buy our product than the competitor’s.  In retrospect, all that the development team has done is for the benefit of every gamer out there. We can finally offer a product that is better but cost lower.

Top 10 Reasons why our cable is different:

  • Reason 1: Feel more confidence while playing because you are using a cable that specifically designed for gaming console and developed for the gaming console like Xbox, PS3, Wii, etc.  Why use generic cables when you have one designed to enhance your gaming console.
  • Reason 2: Enjoy Real HD experience as the cable is optimized for game playing, perfect for games with intricate details. 
  • Reason 3: Say goodbye to delayed/lagging issue. We deliver faster speed than any commercially available cables
  • Reason 4: Fully Optimized for 3D gaming graphic (like Racing game, First-person shooter, or RPG game)
  • Reason 5: Experience the real 3D (if games support it) when played on a real 3D TV.
  • Reason 6: Enjoy Hassle Free installation and maximum quality graphic with Innovative Flat HD jacket technology. Studies have proven that a flat design is much better than a round cable.  The cables are harder to break because of the even pressure of the cable, designed to handle bending and other related stress.  A flat design is also much better aesthetically because the cables can be hidden a lot better (under carpets, behind TV’s, inside tables etc.).
  • Reason 7: You can Feel Safer with our “Cotton sleeve” material cable ensuring high insulating control to avoid heat and short-circuit danger risk.
  • Reason 8: Enjoy maximum performance from new generation 1080p HDTVs, DVD players, and HD cable/satellite receivers
  • Reason 9: The cable is designed with the same feature and quality with the most expensive cables out there.
  • Reason 10: All of these is planned to be sold for half the price of our competitors

 

Side by side comparison (from the video)

 

 

 

Platinum Gold Pro Vs Normal HDMI cable

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Developing a production line for this technology costs a lot of money.  Investments have been flowing for the research and development stage, to ensure that we will have the perfect product.  Now that we are on the last stage of production, we ask all of you to help us out.  The USD 10,000 will ensure that the production line will be created for us to finally show the world the results of our hard work .

Right now, we have built the prototype, we have sent it out to product testers for reviews, but now we need to mass produce… we need your help.

This is a new and innovative product; we have developed the cable to compliment the needs of all gamers out there.  All advisers say that we sell this product for 80USD to cover all the R&D expenses.  For a limited time and to show our thanks we will give it as a gift for as low as donating half the price even more.  Help us keep the price by supporting our project.

 

ABOUT US

 We are a start-up that was organized to invent and design new technologies that will help gamers and non-gamers alike.  The company has already developed other cables that are used specifically for the Xbox 360.  In wanting to focus on research and development, the company decided to authorize an agent to sell our products, thus www.360hdmi.com was created for that purpose.  It is in our vision and mission statement that we continue developing new products and gadgets in the future, we won’t stop unless people stop patronizing our products.  So please support our project, in doing so we can maintain to create more new and helpful products. 

 

We give our commitment that our cables are the best if not at par with all the premium cables in the market.  We are committed that we use the best of technologies to create a product that we are proud of.  We consider ourselves the best in the market and we assure that we will satisfy your needs.

  

CABLE SPECIFICATION:

  • HDMI VERSION 1.4 | Compatible with backward HDMI versions (1.3,1.2,1.1)
  • 3D over HDMI | HDMI Ethernet Channel
  • Dual-Stream 1080p | X.V. enhanced color space
  • Auto lip-sync | 4k x 2k video support
  • Audio Return Channel | 24k Gold Plated Connectors
  • High Purity Oxygen Free Copper | High Density Aluminum Foil Shield
  • Triple Shield tech | Metal Type with cotton sleeve
  • HDMI ATC 1.4a certificated. UL/CE/FCC/RoHs Certified

 

FAQ 

Is the cable really effective, will it really function as stated?

  •  We are gamers too; we designed the cable exclusively for you.  Yes it is effective and will function flawlessly.  We took time to research and develop the product, then test it with official gamer testers.  We have seen the product work… we confidence that it will do what it is designed to do.

Is the cable only designed for Xbox360, as based on its namesake? 

  • No, our cable may look at first as designed only for xbox360.  Yes, it was developed for it at first, but because of the technical requirements of the xbox360 (which is designed for 720p output), we challenged to find ways to make it better.  The logic behind this is, if we can deliver good quality in a console that doesn’t provide highest graphic, definitely we will also can deliver good quality in other consoles too. In doing so, in solving and designing for the weaknesses and technical difficulties of the xbox360, we have developed a product that will be perfect for any console
Wii has a different connectors than other players, will it work for Wii?

Yes, If used with a Wii connector converter, you can experience the same quality and speed that the cable can provide. You can get "The Seriously Wii Gamer" perk to get this Wii converter and the cable

Will it work for any HD players (blu-ray, DVD, Media tanks, etc)

  • Yes, we designed it for gaming, but it will also work the same wonder with other media.

Why sell it for half the price?  Price might affect quality.

  • We want to mass produce so that we can save on economies of scale.  We believe everybody deserves to have this product, so we want everybody to afford it.  That is why we are asking for your help so that we can start mass producing and make sure we always maintain our price.

 

Xbox 360 HDMI - Wii HDMI - Playstation 3 HDMI Gaming Cable Teaser Video

Please click here to see the video

story:
We are proud to announce 1REMOTE, the world's most universal remote control.

1REMOTE is a new kind of universal remote control that works a lot like a mouse. Think of it as a mouse that is also a laser pointer. You hold it in your hand and point at things around you.

Control your:
  • Home theater system
  • Television
  • Cable or satellite
  • Sound system
  • Computers
  • Security systems
  • Lights
With your thumb you can click, double click and right click on the two buttons. You can also swipe to scroll. The green laser dot shows you where you are pointing, just like a laser pointer.

Watch the pitch video below to learn more about the campaign. Watch the how it works video above to learn about the device:


Campaign purpose

The purpose of these campaigns is two-fold: Firstly to raise funds for the development and production of the product, but more importantly to create awareness of the product, to get a support base of thousands of supporters and users so that we can apply pressure on manufacturers of electronics equipment to become compliant with our technologies. We also want to find potential technology partners, and that is already starting to work. The funding will be used to take the product to the Beta stage.

Ever wish you had one remote for everything?

TV, sound system, DVD player, satellite … way too much coffee table clutter, right? Don’t you wish you had one remote that could control it all?  

Well, yes, there is the universal remote. Complicated. Millions of buttons. None of which dim your lights or start the aircon. Or open your gate, garage door or unlock your car.

All that is about to change with Oneremote. It’s sheer genius. A compact device with three simple actions. Point. Swipe. Click.

Really.

It is small and sexy. Fits in your hand like it was designed to be there. Come to think of it, it was! Slip it into your pants pocket, and it curves around your thigh like a second skin. Slick. But hang on, why would you want to carry a TV remote around with you? Good question. Read on.

Personal power

Oneremote is a personal remote. Each has a built-in, unique identity that can never be changed. That identity is transmitted securely whenever you interact with a device. Because you care who can open your garage door, garden gate or unlock your car, house or office.

Oneremote gets registered to you on a central database. If you lose it, or it gets stolen, it can be identified whenever it is found. If someone uses it on a web-connected device, you can find them. If you sell it, you have to transfer ownership, just like a car or a firearm.

Is it really so easy to use?

Anyone that can use a computer mouse, can use 1REMOTE. Set it up by choosing your components from a list, and tell the system where they are located by pointing at them, and you're done. Define your hotspots for volume, channels or other frequently used commands and you're done. Now browse your device's menus and commands on screen, like using a mouse on your computer. For devices like music players we will be designing simple add-on command screens, that can either project simple menus on a wall or on a small screen.

I love it! I want it! I want to help make it happen!

Great! Get involved. Contribute to this funding campaign. With your help, we can do things faster and better. Join the beta tester programme, and be part of the team. As a beta tester, you will get early release products, sneak previews of coming equipment and much more. As the campaign goes to the next phases, we will be adding even more perks

Contributions are via Paypal only. If you don't have a Paypal account, you can still contribute by credit card. Read how to here.

Meanwhile, behind the scenes …

We are planning to take the product into beta testing around middle 2014 and to have it available on the market towards the end of 2014. Meanwhile, our multi-disciplinary team is working hard at making it all work. In our coming campaigns you will be hearing more about these stages:

  • Patenting the technology and protecting the brands and designs
  • Design and construction of devices
  • Beta testing with our community
  • Finding technology partners to integrate our technology
  • Advertising campaigns

If you can’t contribute financially, you can still help. Join our Facebook page. Tweet, or plus one us. Tell you friends about us.

FAQ

You ran another Indiegogo campaign previously. What's up with that?

In October we ran a trial Indiegogo campaign to learn about how crowd funding works and see if there was interest in our product. You can find that campaign here. There was, and now we are running a proper campaign to raise money to fund the next stage of development and take the product to Beta testing. We are planning a third campaign towards the middle of next year to fund the first production run, should we need to.

You ran a previous campaign with different perks. Will we still be getting our perks from that campaign?

Of course, we will honour any commitments made during that campaign.

How is Oneremote different from other universal remotes?

It is different because of the ability to point precisely, whether it's at a menu on a screen, or a light switch or garage door. You click, double click or swipe to give your instruction. Think of it as having a mouse that you can use virtually anywhere. It's so intuitive you hardly need to think about what you're doing.

How does it work?

1REMOTE is a new kind of remote that works like a mouse. Think of it as a mouse that is also a laser pointer. You hold it in your hand and point at things around you. With your thumb you can click, double click and right click on the two buttons. You can also swipe to scroll. The green laser dot shows you where you are pointing, just like a laser pointer.

I have a learning remote. I can program it by pointing my old remote at it and mapping the signal it sends to the keys on the new one.

Yes, we will be doing that, but only as a last resort. By the time we go to market, most popular remotes should already be in our database, due to the Beta programme. If somebody else has already done the work, you don't have to redo it.


A remote cannot communicate with a garage door and car lock on its own. How will you address that?

That is correct, it would require either a compatible garage door opener or car door lock - or it would require an additional (quite simple in the case of the garage door) piece of hardware to emulate the existing remote control. Car doors will probably have to wait until car manufacturers implement our technology, which is on the road map.

Devices like TVs and Blu-ray players are unable to be controlled by a swipe type gesture control. How can you support that?

Yes, gestures are interpreted by the commander and translated into the appropriate commands for the device by the commander unit. It is however our plan to get manufacturers to implement our technology, so that TVs come with the gesturing capability built in.


What is the 'eye'?

The eye is what makes 1REMOTE smart. Like a mouse, not just a laser pointer. Whenever the remote points anywhere near the eye, the eye is able to detect where it is pointing. Let’s call this the zone.

What is the 'zone'?

The zone is a circular area around the eye where the eye can detect very accurately where the remote is pointing. It can also detect any actions being performed on the remote. That’s cool, but so what?

Plug it into a USB on your laptop or connect via Bluetooth and it becomes a very cool presentation tool - a laser pointer that’s also a mouse. That’s right, click on a menu item, and something happens!

Can the remote and the eye control my entertainment system by themselves?

No, unless you have a compliant AV receiver. It is not impossible that your receiver could be compliant by the time we release, as we will be working with manufacturers over the next year to achieve exactly this objective. It could be that you would only need to upgrade the firmware on your receiver, and you are in business. Otherwise, you will need the 'commander'.

What is the 'commander'?

The commander is the brain of the outfit as far as controlling complicated AV equipment goes. It communicates with your components using infrared, Ethernet, Z-wave, USB or Wi-Fi, whichever your device supports. It is easy to set up and we will have a preloaded database of thousands of devices by the time we go to market, thanks to our army of BETA testers.

I don't have an AV receiver, what now?

You will need one of our HDMI switches. Available in 4 and 8 ports, these switches complete the line-up required to control virtually any reasonable AV setup.

How will you make sure it works with everything?

Through our funding campaigns we are inviting contributors to participate in our Beta programme. A thousand enthusiastic contributors will be testing and working with us to ensure that we can handle the vast majority of electronics out there. We will have a shared database where users can add their stuff. If somebody has added it, you don't have to redo the work. We will be working with manufacturers to ensure new stuff comes ready-made for our remote, and those things which can get software updates can even be retrofitted with our technology.

So I have to get another 2-3 devices to control my other 3 devices?

Hopefully only one or two, if you have a compliant receiver or TV. Which may be only a firmware upgrade away by the time we release. In that case you only need the remote and the eye, which is tiny and unobtrusive.

You guys are based in Africa. Can you really do something this big?

South African inventions have famously simplified life around the globe. The first automated pool cleaner was invented by South Africans. So was the Steadicam. South African entrepreneurs have had a huge impact on the world. Elon Musk, founder of SpaceX and co-founder of PayPal and Tesla motors, was born and schooled here. The first heart transplant was done in South Africa. There are world leaders in mining, industry and yes, even electronics based right here. We're talking to some of them already.

The short answer is, yes.


The perks at standard prices - there may be some specials:


Remote only - control compatible devices


Remote plus eye - presenter kit. Control compatible receivers or televisions. Can also be used as the coolest presentation tool ever!

Remote plus eye plus commander - control the vast majority of AV systems that have a receiver.


The full set - remote, eye, commander and HDMI switch. Control most AV systems straight out of the box.

story_txt:
We are proud to announce 1REMOTE, the world's most universal remote control.
1REMOTE is a new kind of universal remote control that works a lot like a mouse. Think of it as a mouse that is also a laser pointer. You hold it
in your hand and point at things around you. 
Control your:

Home theater system
Television
Cable or satellite
Sound system
Computers
Security systems
Lights


With your thumb you can click, double click and right click on the two buttons. You can also swipe to scroll.
The green laser dot shows you where you are pointing, just like a laser pointer.
Watch the pitch video below to learn more about the campaign. Watch the how it works video above to learn about the device:



Campaign purpose
The purpose of these campaigns is two-fold: 
Firstly to raise funds for the development and production of the product, but more importantly to create awareness of the product, to get a support base of thousands of supporters and users so that we can apply pressure on manufacturers of electronics equipment to become compliant with our technologies. We also want to find potential technology partners, and that is already starting to work. The funding will be used to take the product to the Beta stage.
Ever wish you had one remote for everything?
TV, sound system, DVD player, satellite … way too much coffee table clutter, right? Don’t you wish you had one remote that could control it all?  
Well, yes, there is the universal remote. Complicated. Millions of buttons. None of which dim your lights or start the aircon. Or open your gate, garage door or unlock your car.
All that is about to change with Oneremote. It’s sheer genius. A compact device with three simple actions. Point. Swipe. Click.
Really.

It is small and sexy. Fits in your hand like it was designed to be there. Come to think of it, it was! Slip it into your pants pocket, and it curves around your thigh like a second skin. Slick. But hang on, why would you want to carry a TV remote around with you? 
Good question. Read on.
Personal power
Oneremote is a personal remote. Each has a built-in, unique identity that can never be changed. That identity is transmitted securely whenever you interact with a device. Because you care who can open your 
garage door, garden gate or unlock your car, house or office.
Oneremote gets registered to you on a central database. If you lose it, or it gets stolen, it can be identified whenever it is found. If someone uses it on a web-connected device, you can find them. If you sell it, you have to transfer 
ownership, just like a car or a firearm.Is it really so easy to use?Anyone that can use a computer mouse, can use 1REMOTE. Set it up by choosing your components from a list, and tell the system where they are located by pointing at them, and you're done. Define your hotspots for volume, channels or other frequently used commands and you're done. Now browse your device's menus and commands on screen, like using a mouse on your computer. For devices like music players we will be designing simple add-on command screens, that can either project simple menus on a wall or on a small screen.
I love it! I want it! I want to help make it happen!
Great! Get involved. Contribute to this funding campaign. With your help, we can do things faster and better. Join the beta tester programme, and be part of the team. As a beta tester, you will get early release products, sneak previews of coming equipment and much more. As the campaign goes to the next phases, we will be adding even more perksContributions are via Paypal only. If you don't have a Paypal account, you can still contribute by credit card. Read how to here.
Meanwhile, behind the scenes …
We are planning to take the product into beta testing around middle 2014 and to have it available on the market towards the end of 2014. Meanwhile, our multi-disciplinary team is working hard at making it all work. In our coming campaigns you will be hearing more about these stages:

Patenting the technology and protecting the brands and designs
Design and construction of devices
Beta testing with our community
Finding technology partners to integrate our technology
Advertising campaigns
If you can’t contribute financially, you can still help. Join our Facebook page. Tweet, or plus one us. Tell you friends about us.
FAQ
You ran another Indiegogo campaign previously. What's up with that?In October we ran a trial Indiegogo campaign to learn about how crowd funding works and see if there was interest in our product. You can find that campaign here. There was, and now we are running a proper campaign to raise money to fund the next stage of development and take the product to Beta testing. We are planning a third campaign towards the middle of next year to fund the first production run, should we need to.You ran a previous campaign with different perks. Will we still be getting our perks from that campaign?Of course, we will honour any commitments made during that campaign.How is Oneremote different from other universal remotes?It is different because of the ability to point precisely, whether it's at a menu on a screen, or a light switch or garage door. You click, double click or swipe to give your instruction. Think of it as having a mouse that you can use virtually anywhere. It's so intuitive you hardly need to think about what you're doing.How does it work?1REMOTE is a new kind of remote that works like a mouse. Think of it as a mouse that is also a laser pointer. You hold it in your hand and point at things around you. With your thumb you can click, double click and right click on the two buttons. You can also swipe to scroll. The green laser dot shows you where you are pointing, just like a laser pointer.I have a learning remote. I can program it by pointing my old remote at it and mapping the signal it sends to the keys on the new one.

Yes, we will be doing that, but only as a last resort. By the time we go to market, most popular remotes should already be in our database, due to the Beta programme. If somebody else has already done the work, you don't have to redo it.A remote cannot communicate with a garage door and car lock on its own. How will you address that?That is correct, it would require either a compatible garage door opener or car door lock - or it would require an additional (quite simple in the case of the garage door) piece of hardware to emulate the existing remote control. Car doors will probably have to wait until car manufacturers implement our technology, which is on the road map.Devices like TVs and Blu-ray players are unable to be controlled by a swipe type gesture control. How can you support that?Yes, gestures are interpreted by the commander and translated into the appropriate commands for the device by the commander unit. It is however our plan to get manufacturers to implement our technology, so that TVs come with the gesturing capability built in.
