Summary of Financial Analysis:
We anticipate a wide acceptance of this new service in parts of Western Europe, and especial in parts of Asia where easy access to the Internet is norm, and eventually in other parts of the world as services become more popular by word of mouth. We won't advertise and we will not use advertisers, but we will need to be ready to embrace demand growth. 

Sales are automated through Paypal, and registrations need to be automated through computers, so we need your support to put these systems in place. Our financials are based upon the most conservative model, however this whole operation will probably go "viral" since it's proven the first of its kind.

Our charts may seem impressive even though they are built from very conservative growth estimates, because the growth of a truly great free service may be very difficult to predict. The Chart above is taken from  a linear growth forecast, one which takes five (5) server user capacity and start at 2% of this capacity for the first month using number of users and their registration fees in social categories only. Each month following, growth is 150% of the month before across twelve months. For example, five servers with maximum capacity set at 200 society groups of 40, will be 8,000 users. 2% would be 160 different users, and 8 different Society Group Administrators(SGAs). The next month at 150% rises to 240 users and 12 Society Group Administrators. 

One-Time Set-up Fees are:



Society Group Administrator - someone who can invite others, and who can start a group: A one-time Setup Fee:   $2.50 


Society Member - someone who gets invited into a societal group by Society Group Administrator: A one-time Setup Fee:   $1.50 



Business Society Groups are divided into three categories: Small to Medium Enterprises Society Group - 20 (SME-20s), Small to Medium Enterprises Society Group - 40 and Large Corporate Conglomerate Society Group - 200 (LCCSG-200). All work a little differently as businesses from the social classes and therefore must purchase the entire group of sizes 20, 40 and 200 under each SMEs and LCCSGs before filling them with members. This is advanced fee revenues for P4 and will largely be the revenues which replaces any need for advertisers. At any time the only charge will be a one time fee for self registration which provides an avoidance use of any information of any kind albeit private or non-private, the one-time fee creates a contractual bond between P4 and the users to maintain security and information privacy within each society. No other fees are required, and fees act as the contract between the user and P4, which is why they are so small.








Help Us Go out and make something Really Great!!

story:
Cocoon combines HD Camera, Motion Detection & Subsound® Technology to sense activity throughout your home, all controlled through your smartphone so you can take action and feel safe.

Cocoon learns who should and shouldn't be there. There's no need to set it when you come and go and it learns what's normal for your home.


"Potentially solves the shortcomings of most camera/motion detection-based smart home security systems" - TechCrunch

"In the game of crazy cool hearing, but the way it does so feels more like wizardry" - Fast Company 

"Think of Cocoon as a guard god, one that can send you a push notification whenever something seems amiss." - CNET

"Cocoon wasn't just made to keep your home safe, but to complement it" - Gadget Review

One Cocoon can protect a whole home. Our unique Subsound® Technology senses activity in other rooms and on other floors without the need for any additional sensors.

Cocoon tunes itself to your environment so you can trust it to know when to alert you.  With Cocoon, you can check in on your home at any time.

Whether you're at home, at the office, or lazing by the pool, Cocoon is with you. With intelligent notifications and HD video on your smartphone, Cocoon lets you see when something's wrong and control the response. Sound the siren, call the Police or a neighbour - you decide.

There's no need to set it as you come and go, Cocoon uses smartphone location to know who's at home. Cocoon has no sensor batteries to replace and you can take it with you when you move.

Cocoon gives you the peace of mind that your whole home is safe without lots of boxes and detectors, it's clever enough to know who should and shouldn't be there. Cocoon learns your schedule to activate protection whilst you sleep and with night-vision you can rest easy knowing that it was just a 'bump' in the night. 

We believe that home security should be simple and accessible to everyone. Cocoon packs all the security you need into one small package. 

Each Cocoon contains everything needed to keep your home and loved ones safe. No extra sensors. No installation. Putting people at the centre of home security.

Shortlisted for the 2014 London Design Award! Cocoon is great functionality and beautiful design coupled with effortless interaction. 

Designed to complement your personal space. Your Cocoon is made from high-quality materials and a great user experience starts the moment you first meet. 

Your home is an incredibly personal space. Designed not as an electronic accessory but to complement your home, we recognised not just the importance of form but also that it cannot be divorced from function.

The sphere is the simplest of forms, its surface constant and naturally perfect. Enveloping its contents in a protective way, the shape embodies the spirit of Cocoon and allows the camera to be positioned where you need it.





Cocoon's Subsound® technology profiles infrasound and audible sound waves to create a protective 'cocoon' inside your home. Subsound® allows Cocoon to detect activity well beyond the room you place it in, through walls and on other floors.

The study of low-frequency sounds (below 20Hz) outside the range of human hearing, or 'infrasonics' has long been used by seismologists for earthquake detection and geologists to study rock formations deep within the earth.

The same technology used to detect shock waves travelling through the planet can now be used to detect movement throughout your home.


With built-in machine learning, Cocoon understands what activity in your home is normal, so when an unusual event occurs you can be alerted and take action.

We've achieved the ability to protect a whole home from one beautifully crafted device that's intelligent enough to learn what's normal for your home.



We understand how incredibly important your personal space is. From a team with a strong security background, SSL and firewalls are just the basic layer of Cocoon's data security.


When you're at home, Cocoon indicates remote viewing by another user with sound and pulsing LED. Remote viewing can be easily disabled until you go out, so you're always in control.

Cocoon only pushes video to your smartphone if there is an unusual event detected or you request it, meaning everything stays locally (in your home) unless it absolutely needs to be uploaded.

Video and other data is encrypted both at rest and during transmission (256-bit AES) and decryption keys are only held on your registered mobile devices for added protection. Our cloud never sees your encryption keys, guaranteeing that your data can never be leaked.


We have working prototypes running in our alpha testers' homes including the Subsound® detection and learning software and a functional version of our mobile app.

We have identified and are working with our UK manufacturing partners. Cocoon's enclosure is designed and has been produced. Our electronics Bill of Materials (BOM) is complete and our first PCB design with production components is in testing.

We will soon begin work on

  • PCB validation and testing
  • Design for manufacture
  • Supply chain setup
  • User experience design
  • Completion of our software feature set including setup process

In short, we have prepared our technology, or core team is in place and we are ready to execute on our go-to-market plan.


Cocoon's founders believe in a vision of beautifully designed smart home products that put people at the centre of the experience. We believe technology should effortlessly and securely fit into people's lives. This people-centred approach is at the core of what we do. We are ready to take the Cocoon prototype through the manufacturing process into your homes.


Sanjay Parekh, Commercial
Former CEO of WebExpenses and chartered management accountant. Sanjay ensures that we operate as efficiently as possible and is focused on our supply chain, production and distribution.  He is passionate about quality.

Dan Conlon, Product Management
Founder of successful technology businesses Donhost & Humyo. After Humyo was acquired by Internet Security company Trend Micro in 2010, Dan directed the roll-out of its storage technology in Japan where the technology was sold as a hardware device.

Nick Gregory, Hardware Engineering
Electronics engineering graduate with years of experience. Former Donhost & Humyo CTO. Nick spent five years building security infrastructure for global cloud security leader Trend Micro and now works on Cocoon's hardware and security.

John Berthels, Software Engineering
John has enjoyed working on big systems and cryptography in his former roles at Humyo and Trend Micro. He now leads the development of our software and Subsound® technology.

Colin Richardson, Marketing
User experience and customer guy. Colin worked at security companies McAfee and Trend Micro before starting Cocoon. Colin looks after our marketing strategy and spends lots of time learning from our prospective customers.

 

We want to make homes safer with a simple yet powerful solution that is truly effective.

We've been working on Cocoon since the start of the year and now need your help to set up our manufacturing and tooling. We are dedicated to transforming home security and need your support to build a community not just a company.

Why support us

  • You don't use the security you have or don't have any useful security.
  • You love to know what's happening in your home when you're out and about or away for long periods.
  • You love great design and want to be the first to have an iconic home security device.

Your money will only be used to build your product - all funds pledged will be ring-fenced for tooling and component costs only.


We've developed our prototype that with your help and the team we've assembled should mean that we successfully deliver on our plans. We are at an early stage in our development and we may find that through our testing and refinement process that unanticipated problems occur.

We are manufacturing in our home country (United Kingdom) to reduce some of the risks. However bringing any new idea to market results in unforeseen issues which we will endeavor to minimise to ensure Cocoon is delivered according to our planned schedule.

Some of the issues which may be challenging are below:

FCC and CE testing
The device has to meet FCC and CE certification standards, but until the final prototype is built we will not be able to do the actual testing. This may mean we need to revise the electronics to pass the tests, which could cause delays.

Sourcing
We have identified and are working with our manufacturing partners and component suppliers, but until we know from this Indiegogo project how large our first production run will be we can't get delivery commitments or finalise our negotiations with the manufacturers.

Manufacturing
Although we have developed multiple software businesses in the past and have experience of hardware products, manufacturing isn't without risks. One key challenge is quality control. We have decided to produce the first production run locally to minimise the manufacturing risks, by being close to the manufacturing process we can ensure tight feedback loops and personal involvement in quality control.

  • How does Cocoon work?
  • How does Cocoon hear activities in a home?
  • If humans can't hear infrasound, how can Cocoon?
  • What is SUBSOUND™ and how is this different from infrasound?
  • Why is SUBSOUND™ better at home monitoring than other technologies?
  • Will Cocoon work in areas with high infrasound presence, like homes next to wind turbines?
  • Can Cocoon recognise off-schedule or irregular events in a home?
  • How does Cocoon know which sounds are “normal” and which constitute a security threat? Will Cocoon alert users to abnormal sounds that are not security threats, like accidentally dropping a bottle on the floor?
  • How do users enable Cocoon's security features when they leave home?
  • Can Cocoon accommodate multiple-occupancy, multi-user households, in which occupants come and go at different times?
  • How can only one Cocoon listen to and protect an entire house?
  • If Cocoon is so sensitive, won't it pick up users' neighbours' movements, too?
  • Cocoon listens to and watches homes all day - how does it protect their privacy and how will it safeguard householders' data?
  • Will Cocoon integrate with other services like IFTT, Apple HomeKit or SmartThings?
  • Some crowdfunded smart home products underwhelm backers - what product quality assurances does Cocoon offer?
  • If something sets off an alert elsewhere in the house from the Cocoon how can the user know how to deal with the alert?
  • What happens if I have guests - will Cocoon consider this an unusual event?
  • What happens if an alert triggers and I can't access my phone?
  • What happens if my phone line is cut or my internet connection is lost?
  • Does Cocoon need to use a telephone line?
  • What power fitments will Cocoon support?
  • What happens if an intruder cuts the power to the home before attempting to break in?


How does Cocoon work?

Cocoon detects activity in the home using its built-in infrasound and other sensors (motion detection, audible sound analysis) and uses machine learning algorithms to separate activity that is normal for your home that you might like to know about. We call this technology Subsound®.

Cocoon connects over the internet via our cloud service to your smartphones using geo-fencing to determine who's at home. This presence information is combined with learning your schedule to identify unusual events that occur - e.g. a front door being opened downstairs when the family are in bed or an unknown person moving through the property when you are away from the home. There's no need to create traditional 'zones' that you get in standard alarm systems or for the installation of other sensors.

Cocoon sends notifications of unusual events to your smartphone from which you can access live and recorded audio and video from your home. If you have a large property and you want greater camera coverage then more than one Cocoon can work together to provide this.

How does Cocoon hear activities in a home?

If you picture your house as being underwater, you can see that a door opening or closing upstairs or a person moving around will make the water move in various ways around the house.  The same effect happens with the air in your house. An appropriate sensor can detect the air pressure changes or 'ripples' which correspond to activity in the home.

Cocoon is packed full of high quality sensors that it uses to detect these ripples caused by activity in the home and convert them into digital signals. Each action is different and creates its own digital signature, like a fingerprint, that Cocoon uses to build profiles for what is normal in your home.

If humans can't hear infrasound, how can Cocoon?

Humans hear within the audible range of 20Hz - 20kHz but infrasound is classified as sound below that of human hearing (below 20Hz). Cocoon uses a powerful microphone to detect infrasound.

What is Subsound® and how is this different from infrasound?

Subsound® is the combination of sound wave detection (audible, and infrasound), digital profiling and machine learning. Subsound® lets Cocoon detect and make sense of the noise created by activity throughout your home so it can notify you if anything unusual happens so you can take action.

Infrasound is simply a frequency of sound wave so low (<20Hz) that we can't hear it. Infrasound can be created by many things in and around the home but on its own it has a very low chance of correctly indicating unusual activity.

Why is Subsound® better at home monitoring than other technologies?

Subsound® technology enables Cocoon to detect and profile activity throughout the home without the need for additional sensors. This means that you only need one small Cocoon device in order to keep the typical home or apartment secure, eliminating the need for expensive wired home security systems and you don't have to remember to arm or disarm it.

Subsound® gives the peace of mind that the whole home is actually safe whereas regular smart cameras can only protect what they can see and suffer from false positives (e.g. rapidly changing light levels in the room monitored or vehicles passing outside).

Will Cocoon work in areas with high infrasound presence, like homes next to wind turbines?

Yes, Cocoon is smart enough to learn what is normal for your home and only triggers when an unusual event occurs within the walls of your home.

The term "Infrasound" on its own refers to any low-frequency sound waves. Just as our ears and brain can tell the difference between the audible noise of door closing and a train rumbling past, the sensors and software in Cocoon can tell the difference between the infrasound profile of a moving door and a wind turbine.  

Can Cocoon recognise off-schedule or irregular events in a home?

Yes. Cocoon actually works by understanding what is normal in your home and then notifying you when unusual (irregular) activity occurs.

How does Cocoon know which sounds are “normal” and which constitute a security threat? Will Cocoon alert users to abnormal sounds that are not security threats, like accidentally dropping a bottle on the floor?

Cocoon continually analyzes the readings from its sensors. A notable audio event can be processed to extract an audio "fingerprint". Different kinds of sounds, for example, jangling keys, the click of a door or loud music from next door all have different fingerprints.

In this way, Cocoon can turn the raw stream of audio data into a more comprehensible stream of events, with associated data. These events can then be analysed to discover patterns, as Cocoon learns what is normal for your household. This analysis is then used to build a model of what events are expected, tailored to your specific household.

With this model, augmented by information from your mobile app about when you are home or away, Cocoon can decide if a sensor event is likely to be significant, and show it to you.

Over time Cocoon adapts to your home, learning new profiles and adapting to your routine. You can also indicate to Cocoon that a type of unusual event reported to you is OK.

How do users enable Cocoon's security features when they leave home?

Cocoon automatically detects when you are at home and when you have left using geo-fencing on your smartphone so there is no need to arm or disarm it. You can check in on your home any time using the Cocoon mobile app, streaming HD video and audio straight to your smartphone, trigger the built-in siren or contact the Police.  

Can Cocoon accommodate multiple-occupancy, multi-user households, in which occupants come and go at different times?

Yes. Just install the app on each authorised occupant's phone and Cocoon will know who is at home and behave accordingly.

How can only one Cocoon listen to and protect an entire house?

When any wave fits through a gap it will spread out a bit.  The greater the wavelength, the more it will spread out.  Because the 'ripples' or waves of air pressure changes Cocoon monitors are of very low frequency they spread out a lot allowing them to travel a long way around a building, even though the tiniest of gaps.

Cocoon is packed full of high-quality sensors that it uses to detect these ripples which it converts into digital signals. Each action is different and creates it own digital signature, like a fingerprint, that Cocoon uses to build profiles and determine whether activity is normal.

If Cocoon is so sensitive, won't it pick up users' neighbours' movements, too?

Activity in adjacent buildings can cause "background noise" in the infrasound frequencies, but without a direct airflow between the properties, there are measurable differences in the sensor readings, which Cocoon can use to distinguish the two.

If there is a direct airflow, for example if there is a shared hallway or similar, then the area covered by Cocoon is typically smaller and the software within Cocoon can adjust the overall sensitivity during the learning phase. Air pressure changes over time and audible sound helps Cocoon to confirm if an unusual event is specific to your home or your neighbours having a party!

Cocoon listens to and watches homes all day - how does it protect their privacy and how will it safeguard householders' data?

We understand that security must be delivered without compromising the ultimately privacy of the home.

4 of the 5 Cocoon founding team come from the world's leading Internet Security companies such as Trend Micro and McAfee. Having developed cloud storage and internet security products since 2007 they are experienced at securing data on devices and in the cloud and we operate best practices in all of our data centre activity, build and user experience.

When you're home, Cocoon signals remote viewing by another user with a sound and pulsing LED.  Remote viewing can be easily disabled until you go out.

The 'normal' activity data that Cocoon collates never leaves your home. Video is encrypted at rest and in transmission (256bit AES) with decryption keys held only on your mobile devices.  The Cocoon cloud platform never sees decryption keys guaranteeing that data can never be leaked.

Cocoon puts you at the centre of your home security so if an event occurs only you, the authorised user, will have access to the live video feed.

Will Cocoon integrate with other services like IFTT, Apple HomeKit or SmartThings?

We believe in the future of smart home devices working together to improve lives. In support of this vision we commit to always opening our APIs.

Cocoon is a smart, internet-connected device. As we make future releases we will be able to push out new functionality and add features to your Cocoon.

We have plans to integrate with the main home automation platforms in the same way that we support major mobile OS like Android and iOS at a time that there are clear market leaders.

Some crowdfunded smart home products underwhelm backers - what product quality assurances does Cocoon offer?

We are inspired by high-quality products (Apple, Bowers & Wilkins), we refuse to settle on design or build and know that the longevity of our business depends upon delighting our earliest backers.

Many crowdfunded projects struggle due to the inexperience of the founding team. Cocoon's founding team are successful, seasoned start-up entrepreneurs. 4 of the founders are veterans of Humyo, a maker of storage technology which was distributed in Japan as a consumer hardware device.  

The team have researched and sought advice from others with domain knowledge to ensure any skill or knowledge gaps have been identified and filled.  We have engaged external advisers in the fields of electronic hardware production and hardware supply chain to ensure we continue to knowledgeable resources to consult with as we move towards delivery of our product.

Cocoon is designed manufactured and assembled in the UK. We are doing this to ensure that we can directly oversee that each unit is of the highest quality and to avoid communication and time delay issues that often beset start-ups that manufacture in Asia from the outset.

We believe in an ethical approach to business and as such we're ring-fencing the funds raised from crowd funding. We guarantee they will only be used to pay for components, tooling, production and delivery costs.

We will not use crowdfunding money to pay for R&D, salaries, office space etc.

We offer a 12-month manufacturers guarantee on all of our products and 30-day money back guarantee if you're not happy when Cocoon arrives.

If something sets off an alert elsewhere in the house from the Cocoon how can the user know how to deal with the alert?

The live video stream includes high fidelity audio which a user can listen to for handling an alert out of Cocoon's line of sight.  Multiple Cocoons can work together if the user wishes to extend camera coverage.

What happens if I have guests - will Cocoon consider this an unusual event?

No, Cocoon knows you are home due to its geo-fencing capability. Since the house is active and normal daytime activities are being senses leading up to and during the guest visit, Cocoon will not activate its night time protection mode.

If someone tries to gain entry to your home in the middle of the night and you are in bed then Cocoon will not treat them as a guest and will inform you of an unusual event occurring in the home.

If a guest arrives (cleaner/etc) and you are away from the home then Cocoon will give you live video of the home straight to your smartphone via the app. You can then decide what you want to do - allow entry, trigger the siren, or indeed call the Police (probably not such a good idea if it is a genuine visitor!).

What happens if an alert triggers and I can't access my phone?

If you live with other people you live with can receive notifications from Cocoon if they have the mobile app installed. You can also set secondary contacts so that in the event that your smartphone is out of reception or if it runs out of battery and an unusual event is detected then a close friend, family member or neighbour will be informed. You should select someone that you trust.

We're also planning to offer an optional subscription that includes a monitored alert service at an additional monthly charge.

Again, you have the option to do this in the case of an emergency and don't have to.

What happens if my phone line is cut or my internet connection is lost?

If Cocoon is disconnected from the main or from the internet then the cloud system will alert the user. Cocoon maintains a heart-beat connection to the cloud system, if that connection is unexpectedly dropped the user is alerted that the internet or power has been cut.

Cocoon learns any normal pattern of drops your connection experiences do if your internet connection dips out occasionally for a couple of minutes the system will learn this and will not send you an alert until the behaviour is out of the ordinary.

Keep in mind that Cocoon records activity on the device locally and only pushes it to the cloud (and then your smartphone) when an unusual event is detected. This means that if the line is cut (highly unlikely) then you'll still have evidence of the crime occurring once the intruder attempts to enter the home.

Does Cocoon need to use a telephone line?

Cocoon doesn't need to use the hard telephone (PSTN) line directly. The device connects to your home WiFi network which then connects to our cloud service and your smartphone(s). The system is secure, encrypting data during transmission and at rest.

What power fitments will Cocoon support?

Cocoon will support US, UK and European power fitments.

What happens if an intruder cuts the power to the home before attempting to break in?

If Cocoon is disconnected from the main or from the internet then the cloud system will alert the user. Cocoon maintains a heart-beat connection to the cloud system, if that connection is unexpectedly dropped the user is alerted that the internet or power has been cut.

Cocoon stores some video and audio locally on the device so if an intruder did take out the home WiFi or phone hardline we'd still have evidence that could be used to aid any Police investigation.

In the future, when there are a lot of Cocoons in your neighbourhood, we'll be able to tell you whether it's only the power or phone line to your home that's down or a general problem in the area too!

Designed to complement your personal space. Your Cocoon is made from high-quality materials and a great user experience starts the moment you first meet. 


Your home is an incredibly personal space. Designed not as an electronic accessory but to complement your home, we recognised not just the importance of form but also that it cannot be divorced from function.
The sphere is the simplest of forms, its surface constant and naturally perfect. Enveloping its contents in a protective way, the shape embodies the spirit of Cocoon and allows the camera to be positioned where you need it.




 

Cocoon's Subsound® technology profiles infrasound and audible sound waves to create a protective 'cocoon' inside your home. Subsound® allows Cocoon to detect activity well beyond the room you place it in, through walls and on other floors.

The study of low-frequency sounds (below 20Hz) outside the range of human hearing, or 'infrasonics' has long been used by seismologists for earthquake detection and geologists to study rock formations deep within the earth.
The same technology used to detect shock waves travelling through the planet can now be used to detect movement throughout your home.
With built-in machine learning, Cocoon understands what activity in your home is normal, so when an unusual event occurs you can be alerted and take action.

We've achieved the ability to protect a whole home from one beautifully crafted device that's intelligent enough to learn what's normal for your home.


We understand how incredibly important your personal space is. From a team with a strong security background, SSL and firewalls are just the basic layer of Cocoon's data security.






When you're at home, Cocoon indicates remote viewing by another user with sound and pulsing LED. Remote viewing can be easily disabled until you go out, so you're always in control.
Cocoon only pushes video to your smartphone if there is an unusual event detected or you request it, meaning everything stays locally (in your home) unless it absolutely needs to be uploaded.
Video and other data is encrypted both at rest and during transmission (256-bit AES) and decryption keys are only held on your registered mobile devices for added protection. Our cloud never sees your encryption keys, guaranteeing that your data can never be leaked.




We have working prototypes running in our alpha testers' homes including the Subsound® detection and learning software and a functional version of our mobile app.
We have identified and are working with our UK manufacturing partners. Cocoon's enclosure is designed and has been produced. Our electronics Bill of Materials (BOM) is complete and our first PCB design with production components is in testing.
We will soon begin work on

PCB validation and testing
Design for manufacture
Supply chain setup
User experience design
Completion of our software feature set including setup process

In short, we have prepared our technology, or core team is in place and we are ready to execute on our go-to-market plan.





Cocoon's founders believe in a vision of beautifully designed smart home products that put people at the centre of the experience. We believe technology should effortlessly and securely fit into people's lives. This people-centred approach is at the core of what we do. We are ready to take the Cocoon prototype through the manufacturing process into your homes.


Sanjay Parekh, CommercialFormer CEO of WebExpenses and chartered management accountant. Sanjay ensures that we operate as efficiently as possible and is focused on our supply chain, production and distribution.  He is passionate about quality.



Dan Conlon, Product ManagementFounder of successful technology businesses Donhost & Humyo. After Humyo was acquired by Internet Security company Trend Micro in 2010, Dan directed the roll-out of its storage technology in Japan where the technology was sold as a hardware device.



Nick Gregory, Hardware EngineeringElectronics engineering graduate with years of experience. Former Donhost & Humyo CTO. Nick spent five years building security infrastructure for global cloud security leader Trend Micro and now works on Cocoon's hardware and security.



John Berthels, Software EngineeringJohn has enjoyed working on big systems and cryptography in his former roles at Humyo and Trend Micro. He now leads the development of our software and Subsound® technology.



Colin Richardson, MarketingUser experience and customer guy. Colin worked at security companies McAfee and Trend Micro before starting Cocoon. Colin looks after our marketing strategy and spends lots of time learning from our prospective customers.


 


We want to make homes safer with a simple yet powerful solution that is truly effective.
We've been working on Cocoon since the start of the year and now need your help to set up our manufacturing and tooling. We are dedicated to transforming home security and need your support to build a community not just a company.
Why support us

You don't use the security you have or don't have any useful security.
You love to know what's happening in your home when you're out and about or away for long periods.
You love great design and want to be the first to have an iconic home security device.

Your money will only be used to build your product - all funds pledged will be ring-fenced for tooling and component costs only.


We've developed our prototype that with your help and the team we've assembled should mean that we successfully deliver on our plans. We are at an early stage in our development and we may find that through our testing and refinement process that unanticipated problems occur.
We are manufacturing in our home country (United Kingdom) to reduce some of the risks. However bringing any new idea to market results in unforeseen issues which we will endeavor to minimise to ensure Cocoon is delivered according to our planned schedule.
Some of the issues which may be challenging are below:
FCC and CE testingThe device has to meet FCC and CE certification standards, but until the final prototype is built we will not be able to do the actual testing. This may mean we need to revise the electronics to pass the tests, which could cause delays.
SourcingWe have identified and are working with our manufacturing partners and component suppliers, but until we know from this Indiegogo project how large our first production run will be we can't get delivery commitments or finalise our negotiations with the manufacturers.
ManufacturingAlthough we have developed multiple software businesses in the past and have experience of hardware products, manufacturing isn't without risks. One key challenge is quality control. We have decided to produce the first production run locally to minimise the manufacturing risks, by being close to the manufacturing process we can ensure tight feedback loops and personal involvement in quality control.



How does Cocoon work?
How does Cocoon hear activities in a home?
If humans can't hear infrasound, how can Cocoon?
What is SUBSOUND™ and how is this different from infrasound?
Why is SUBSOUND™ better at home monitoring than other technologies?
Will Cocoon work in areas with high infrasound presence, like homes next to wind turbines?

How do users enable Cocoon's security features when they leave home?
Can Cocoon accommodate multiple-occupancy, multi-user households, in which occupants come and go at different times?
How can only one Cocoon listen to and protect an entire house?
If Cocoon is so sensitive, won't it pick up users' neighbours' movements, too?
Cocoon listens to and watches homes all day - how does it protect their privacy and how will it safeguard householders' data?
 Will Cocoon integrate with other services like IFTT, Apple HomeKit or SmartThings?
Some crowdfunded smart home products underwhelm backers - what product quality assurances does Cocoon offer?
If something sets off an alert elsewhere in the house from the Cocoon how can the user know how to deal with the alert?
What happens if I have guests - will Cocoon consider this an unusual event?
What happens if an alert triggers and I can't access my phone?

What power fitments will Cocoon support?
What happens if an intruder cuts the power to the home before attempting to break in?


How does Cocoon work?
Cocoon detects activity in the home using its built-in infrasound and other sensors (motion detection, audible sound analysis) and uses machine learning algorithms to separate activity that is normal for your home that you might like to know about. We call this technology Subsound®. Cocoon connects over the internet via our cloud service to your smartphones using geo-fencing to determine who's at home. This presence information is combined with learning your schedule to identify unusual events that occur - e.g. a front door being opened downstairs when the family are in bed or an unknown person moving through the property when you are away from the home. There's no need to create traditional 'zones' that you get in standard alarm systems or for the installation of other sensors.Cocoon sends notifications of unusual events to your smartphone from which you can access live and recorded audio and video from your home. If you have a large property and you want greater camera coverage then more than one Cocoon can work together to provide this.
How does Cocoon hear activities in a home?
If you picture your house as being underwater, you can see that a door opening or closing upstairs or a person moving around will make the water move in various ways around the house.  The same effect happens with the air in your house. An appropriate sensor can detect the air pressure changes or 'ripples' which correspond to activity in the home.
Cocoon is packed full of high quality sensors that it uses to detect these ripples caused by activity in the home and convert them into digital signals. Each action is different and creates its own digital signature, like a fingerprint, that Cocoon uses to build profiles for what is normal in your home.
If humans can't hear infrasound, how can Cocoon? 
Humans hear within the audible range of 20Hz - 20kHz but infrasound is classified as sound below that of human hearing (below 20Hz). Cocoon uses a powerful microphone to detect infrasound.
What is Subsound® and how is this different from infrasound?
Subsound® is the combination of sound wave detection (audible, and infrasound), digital profiling and machine learning. Subsound® lets Cocoon detect and make sense of the noise created by activity throughout your home so it can notify you if anything unusual happens so you can take action.
Infrasound is simply a frequency of sound wave so low (<20Hz) that we can't hear it. Infrasound can be created by many things in and around the home but on its own it has a very low chance of correctly indicating unusual activity.
Why is Subsound® better at home monitoring than other technologies?
Subsound® technology enables Cocoon to detect and profile activity throughout the home without the need for additional sensors. This means that you only need one small Cocoon device in order to keep the typical home or apartment secure, eliminating the need for expensive wired home security systems and you don't have to remember to arm or disarm it.
Subsound® gives the peace of mind that the whole home is actually safe whereas regular smart cameras can only protect what they can see and suffer from false positives (e.g. rapidly changing light levels in the room monitored or vehicles passing outside).
Will Cocoon work in areas with high infrasound presence, like homes next to wind turbines?
Yes, Cocoon is smart enough to learn what is normal for your home and only triggers when an unusual event occurs within the walls of your home.
The term "Infrasound" on its own refers to any low-frequency sound waves. Just as our ears and brain can tell the difference between the audible noise of door closing and a train rumbling past, the sensors and software in Cocoon can tell the difference between the infrasound profile of a moving door and a wind turbine.  
Can Cocoon recognise off-schedule or irregular events in a home?
Yes. Cocoon actually works by understanding what is normal in your home and then notifying you when unusual (irregular) activity occurs.
How does Cocoon know which sounds are “normal” and which constitute a security threat? Will Cocoon alert users to abnormal sounds that are not security threats, like accidentally dropping a bottle on the floor?
Cocoon continually analyzes the readings from its sensors. A notable audio event can be processed to extract an audio "fingerprint". Different kinds of sounds, for example, jangling keys, the click of a door or loud music from next door all have different fingerprints.
In this way, Cocoon can turn the raw stream of audio data into a more comprehensible stream of events, with associated data. These events can then be analysed to discover patterns, as Cocoon learns what is normal for your household. This analysis is then used to build a model of what events are expected, tailored to your specific household.
With this model, augmented by information from your mobile app about when you are home or away, Cocoon can decide if a sensor event is likely to be significant, and show it to you.
Over time Cocoon adapts to your home, learning new profiles and adapting to your routine. You can also indicate to Cocoon that a type of unusual event reported to you is OK.
How do users enable Cocoon's security features when they leave home?
Cocoon automatically detects when you are at home and when you have left using geo-fencing on your smartphone so there is no need to arm or disarm it. You can check in on your home any time using the Cocoon mobile app, streaming HD video and audio straight to your smartphone, trigger the built-in siren or contact the Police.  
Can Cocoon accommodate multiple-occupancy, multi-user households, in which occupants come and go at different times?
Yes. Just install the app on each authorised occupant's phone and Cocoon will know who is at home and behave accordingly.
How can only one Cocoon listen to and protect an entire house?
When any wave fits through a gap it will spread out a bit.  The greater the wavelength, the more it will spread out.  Because the 'ripples' or waves of air pressure changes Cocoon monitors are of very low frequency they spread out a lot allowing them to travel a long way around a building, even though the tiniest of gaps.
Cocoon is packed full of high-quality sensors that it uses to detect these ripples which it converts into digital signals. Each action is different and creates it own digital signature, like a fingerprint, that Cocoon uses to build profiles and determine whether activity is normal.
If Cocoon is so sensitive, won't it pick up users' neighbours' movements, too?
Activity in adjacent buildings can cause "background noise" in the infrasound frequencies, but without a direct airflow between the properties, there are measurable differences in the sensor readings, which Cocoon can use to distinguish the two.
If there is a direct airflow, for example if there is a shared hallway or similar, then the area covered by Cocoon is typically smaller and the software within Cocoon can adjust the overall sensitivity during the learning phase. Air pressure changes over time and audible sound helps Cocoon to confirm if an unusual event is specific to your home or your neighbours having a party!
Cocoon listens to and watches homes all day - how does it protect their privacy and how will it safeguard householders' data?
We understand that security must be delivered without compromising the ultimately privacy of the home.
4 of the 5 Cocoon founding team come from the world's leading Internet Security companies such as Trend Micro and McAfee. Having developed cloud storage and internet security products since 2007 they are experienced at securing data on devices and in the cloud and we operate best practices in all of our data centre activity, build and user experience.
When you're home, Cocoon signals remote viewing by another user with a sound and pulsing LED.  Remote viewing can be easily disabled until you go out.
The 'normal' activity data that Cocoon collates never leaves your home. Video is encrypted at rest and in transmission (256bit AES) with decryption keys held only on your mobile devices.  The Cocoon cloud platform never sees decryption keys guaranteeing that data can never be leaked.
Cocoon puts you at the centre of your home security so if an event occurs only you, the authorised user, will have access to the live video feed.
Will Cocoon integrate with other services like IFTT, Apple HomeKit or SmartThings?
We believe in the future of smart home devices working together to improve lives. In support of this vision we commit to always opening our APIs.
Cocoon is a smart, internet-connected device. As we make future releases we will be able to push out new functionality and add features to your Cocoon.
We have plans to integrate with the main home automation platforms in the same way that we support major mobile OS like Android and iOS at a time that there are clear market leaders.
Some crowdfunded smart home products underwhelm backers - what product quality assurances does Cocoon offer?
We are inspired by high-quality products (Apple, Bowers & Wilkins), we refuse to settle on design or build and know that the longevity of our business depends upon delighting our earliest backers.
Many crowdfunded projects struggle due to the inexperience of the founding team. Cocoon's founding team are successful, seasoned start-up entrepreneurs. 4 of the founders are veterans of Humyo, a maker of storage technology which was distributed in Japan as a consumer hardware device.  
The team have researched and sought advice from others with domain knowledge to ensure any skill or knowledge gaps have been identified and filled.  We have engaged external advisers in the fields of electronic hardware production and hardware supply chain to ensure we continue to knowledgeable resources to consult with as we move towards delivery of our product.
Cocoon is designed manufactured and assembled in the UK. We are doing this to ensure that we can directly oversee that each unit is of the highest quality and to avoid communication and time delay issues that often beset start-ups that manufacture in Asia from the outset.
We believe in an ethical approach to business and as such we're ring-fencing the funds raised from crowd funding. We guarantee they will only be used to pay for components, tooling, production and delivery costs.
We will not use crowdfunding money to pay for R&D, salaries, office space etc.
We offer a 12-month manufacturers guarantee on all of our products and 30-day money back guarantee if you're not happy when Cocoon arrives.
If something sets off an alert elsewhere in the house from the Cocoon how can the user know how to deal with the alert?

The live video stream includes high fidelity audio which a user can listen to for handling an alert out of Cocoon's line of sight.  Multiple Cocoons can work together if the user wishes to extend camera coverage.
What happens if I have guests - will Cocoon consider this an unusual event?
No, Cocoon knows you are home due to its geo-fencing capability. Since the house is active and normal daytime activities are being senses leading up to and during the guest visit, Cocoon will not activate its night time protection mode.
If someone tries to gain entry to your home in the middle of the night and you are in bed then Cocoon will not treat them as a guest and will inform you of an unusual event occurring in the home.
If a guest arrives (cleaner/etc) and you are away from the home then Cocoon will give you live video of the home straight to your smartphone via the app. You can then decide what you want to do - allow entry, trigger the siren, or indeed call the Police (probably not such a good idea if it is a genuine visitor!).
What happens if an alert triggers and I can't access my phone?
If you live with other people you live with can receive notifications from Cocoon if they have the mobile app installed. You can also set secondary contacts so that in the event that your smartphone is out of reception or if it runs out of battery and an unusual event is detected then a close friend, family member or neighbour will be informed. You should select someone that you trust.
We're also planning to offer an optional subscription that includes a monitored alert service at an additional monthly charge.
Again, you have the option to do this in the case of an emergency and don't have to.
What happens if my phone line is cut or my internet connection is lost?
If Cocoon is disconnected from the main or from the internet then the cloud system will alert the user. Cocoon maintains a heart-beat connection to the cloud system, if that connection is unexpectedly dropped the user is alerted that the internet or power has been cut.
Cocoon learns any normal pattern of drops your connection experiences do if your internet connection dips out occasionally for a couple of minutes the system will learn this and will not send you an alert until the behaviour is out of the ordinary.
Keep in mind that Cocoon records activity on the device locally and only pushes it to the cloud (and then your smartphone) when an unusual event is detected. This means that if the line is cut (highly unlikely) then you'll still have evidence of the crime occurring once the intruder attempts to enter the home.
Does Cocoon need to use a telephone line?
Cocoon doesn't need to use the hard telephone (PSTN) line directly. The device connects to your home WiFi network which then connects to our cloud service and your smartphone(s). The system is secure, encrypting data during transmission and at rest.
What power fitments will Cocoon support?
Cocoon will support US, UK and European power fitments.
What happens if an intruder cuts the power to the home before attempting to break in?
If Cocoon is disconnected from the main or from the internet then the cloud system will alert the user. Cocoon maintains a heart-beat connection to the cloud system, if that connection is unexpectedly dropped the user is alerted that the internet or power has been cut.
Cocoon stores some video and audio locally on the device so if an intruder did take out the home WiFi or phone hardline we'd still have evidence that could be used to aid any Police investigation.
In the future, when there are a lot of Cocoons in your neighbourhood, we'll be able to tell you whether it's only the power or phone line to your home that's down or a general problem in the area too!

story:
What can Hey Stick do?

 

1. VIDEO FILMING

 

2. DYNAMIC SELFIES

 

3. FACE TIME

 

4. TIME-LAPSE SHOOTING

 

 

Features And Design

 

1. SMALL

Hey Stick is the smallest and lightest selfie stick on the market, and it looks just like a Pen.

 

2. PORTABLE

Ultra-portable, compact design - so it can be stored almost everywhere, like wallet, small handbag or your pocket.

 

3. STYLIST AND CHIC

Minimalist chic design - it also looks like a lipstick, very chic item in your bag.

 

4. EASY TO USE

Intuitive phone mount, double pull tabs for easy one-hand attach / detach mounting actions – Can't Get Much More Convenient Than This.

 

5. ALL ALUMINUM ALLOY MATERIAL

Just like iPhone, hey stick uses the same aluminum alloy material as what Apple is using. We make deep oxidation and use CNC refined processing technology for integral forming to make it fashion and durable.

6. DETACHABLE BLUETOOTH MODULE

With the unique detachable Bluetooth module, you can use the hey stick in a pretty long distance.

 

 

Production & Package

story:
Mass Production Now Shipping on May

DGRule in the Press

New 16" MacBook Pro is the best ever, but you may realize the limitation of Thunderbolt 3 USB-C ports

The new Thunderbolt 3 USB-C ports still doesn't work with some devices. You need a dongle for everything!

Introducing DGRule Invisible Hub

The world's first invisible USB-C hub for MacBook Pro

Lightweight, portable, convenient and invisible

Invisible design provides multiple functions

Engineered for discretion, DGRule is an invisible hub for all your cords. This gives you dongle-free working space where cables can be seen uncluttered.

The 1st hub designed specifically for the 16" MacBook Pro

Compare with other dongles

Compare to other multiple adapters in the market, it can serve multiple connections simultaneously without creating a mess, connecting to the back of your MacBook.

Replace all other dongles with DGRule Invisible Hub

The multi-tasking hub also has a firm stability feature

Works perfectly on the table and laps

Just simply snap the DGRule on both sides of MacBook

DGRule will not tip over. Snapping into both sides of your MacBook Pro (two Thunderbolt 3 and audio ports), it will stay in place as you need it to so that you can focus on getting your work done, not on keeping your devices plugged in.

Made from CNC aluminum, extremely durable and reliable 

Easy pick and go anywhere with DGRule

The sleek and slim design also fits your MacBook Pro avoiding the hassle of putting it inside your bag.

The most compact & portable Thunderbolt 3 USB-C hub

Simultaneously connect your Thunderbolt 3, HDMI display, USB-C, Mini DP, 3 x USB 3.1 Gen 1, micro SD, SD, and headphones. All while charging 100W at full speed thru DGRule Invisible Hub.

DGRule can reach up to 40 Gb/s data speed

All while charging your MacBook Pro with 100W power 

The built-in cooling pad prevents DGRule from overheating

The built-in cooling pad prevents DGRule from overheating, so you can use it for hours, days, or weeks on end. This will come in handy considering DGRule's 100W power delivery.

Perfectly fits 16"/15"/13" MacBook Pro 2019/2018/2017/2016

Aluminum enclosure color matches to Space Gray and silver MacBook Pro

Process for Making CNC precision milled aluminum enclosure

Take DGRule anytime and anywhere, you don't even notice it

Proof of the DGRule Prototype

The following unbox video presents a fully functional prototype of DGRule invisible hub with all ports working (HDMI display, Thunderbolt 3, USB-C, SD, microSD, USB flash drive & hard drive).

Production

  •  Input: 2 x Thunderbolt 3 USB-C
  •  Output:
                            - 1 X HDMI/1 X MiniDP: resolution is 4K@30Hz max, Support MST and SST, Support 4K/2K for simultaneous use.
                            - 1 X Thunderbolt 3: up to 6K ( max ) or 2 X 4K@60Hz Video Up to 40 Gb/s data speed Max 100W Power Delivery pass through charging.
                            - 1 X USB-C: supports charging, PD3.0, Max 100W and support USB-C 3.1 Gen1 5Gbps data transfer, from Docking output (the max output is share 5V/1.5A).
                            - 3 X USB3.1 Gen 1: transfer rate is 5Gbps. Output is total share 5V/1.5A. Can work with 3 USB flash disk or can work with 1 hard disk + 2 USB flash disk.
                            - 1 X SD/ 1 X Micro SD: supports SD/SDHC/SDXC, SD3.0 UHS-1 with speed up to 104Mb/s, both Micro and SD ports can work simultaneously. Max card reading capacity is 512G. 
                            - 1 X Audio: stereo output and Mic input, 3.5 Audio plug.
  •  Case Material: CNC anodized aluminum enclosure
  •  Color: Space Gray & Silver

To say thanks to our contributors, we are offering DGRule here first – giving you early access to our world-class hub. 

PERK

DGRule will be available in Space Gray or Silver color. Once the campaign ends, we will send out a survey asking you to select the color and size of your DGRule (Space Gray / Silver; 16"/ 15"/ 13").

Reward Fulfilment

To ensure timely reward delivery, we will ship rewards via insured postal service (DHL, FedEx) from fulfillment location in USA and China.

Design and Development

DGRule on CES2020

About Us

For more than ten years working experience, our team has developed computer accessories, including USB card readers, USB flash drives, USB docking systems, USB-C data conversion systems, and video conversion systems. We have seen USB-C reach new popularity levels, and while there are many USB-C-enabled products available, there is no product that is convenient, lightweight, and designed specifically for MacBook users.

Setting out to solve this problem, our research development team spent a whole year investigating and comparing other products, committing ourselves to creating a docking station that would fit with the MacBook Pro both functionally and in terms of style. Using a CNC process aluminum alloy shell, our docking station is lightweight and thin, matching the MacBook perfectly and meeting all your charging, USB, and video interface needs. We call our station DGRule, and it is going to make your life a whole lot easier.

Spread the Word!

In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, go ahead and tell your fellow Apple fans about DGRule. This is a hub that all MacBook Pro users should know about, and you can help us with that in a big way.

We appreciate all your support, monetary and non-monetary alike, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing.

Contact us: hi@dgrulehub.com

www.dgrulehub.com

Output is total share 5V/1.5A. Can work with 3 USB flash disk or can work with 1 hard disk + 2 USB flash disk.                        - 1 X SD/ 1 X Micro SD: supports SD/SDHC/SDXC, SD3.0 UHS-1 with speed up to 104Mb/s, both Micro and SD ports can work simultaneously. Max card reading capacity is 512G.                         - 1 X Audio: stereo output and Mic input, 3.5 Audio plug.
 Case Material: CNC anodized aluminum enclosure
 Color: Space Gray & Silver
To say thanks to our contributors, we are offering DGRule here first – giving you early access to our world-class hub. PERKDGRule will be available in Space Gray or Silver color. Once the campaign ends, we will send out a survey asking you to select the color and size of your DGRule (Space Gray / Silver; 16"/ 15"/ 13").Reward FulfilmentTo ensure timely reward delivery, we will ship rewards via insured postal service (DHL, FedEx) from fulfillment location in USA and China.Design and DevelopmentDGRule on CES2020About UsFor more than ten years working experience, our team has developed computer accessories, including USB card readers, USB flash drives, USB docking systems, USB-C data conversion systems, and video conversion systems. We have seen USB-C reach new popularity levels, and while there are many USB-C-enabled products available, there is no product that is convenient, lightweight, and designed specifically for MacBook users.Setting out to solve this problem, our research development team spent a whole year investigating and comparing other products, committing ourselves to creating a docking station that would fit with the MacBook Pro both functionally and in terms of style. Using a CNC process aluminum alloy shell, our docking station is lightweight and thin, matching the MacBook perfectly and meeting all your charging, USB, and video interface needs. We call our station DGRule, and it is going to make your life a whole lot easier.Spread the Word!In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, go ahead and tell your fellow Apple fans about DGRule. This is a hub that all MacBook Pro users should know about, and you can help us with that in a big way.We appreciate all your support, monetary and non-monetary alike, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing. Contact us: hi@dgrulehub.comwww.dgrulehub.com

story:
I'm a daily user of wireless charging pad who enjoys the technology that helps me get out of the tangle of wires. Charging can be any moments as soon as I put my phone on the charging pad. However, ocasionally I notice some issues that really bother me a lot.
Whenever there's a new message coming in, I have to pick up my phone and interupt the charging.
I can't lay back and enjoy a ball gaming while charing at the same time.
It doesn't work either when I try to connect a Lightning/Type-C earphone jack while charging. 
Although some problems can be resovled by wireless charging stand but it's not always nice for all time. Why buy an even more expensive device but is only good for some occassions? Is there any way to upgrade your wireless charging pad and make it more user-friendly? That's how I invented PlugStand: Wireless Chager Seat.

 

 

 

 

 

We love earth just as much as you do,

All packaging is made by environment friendly paper.

story:
-- Update 3/23/13 --

Help Spread the Word!

You asked, we’ve listened!  You wanted more call options, additional device colors and no drunk texting, so here you go: we are rolling out an exciting Breathometer roadmap, matching stretch goals and great new perks.  We’ve got 19 days, so let’s make this happen!

Thank you for support Breathometer!
Drink Smart. Be Safe.

-- Update 3/13/13 --

Thank you for all your support! 

Although our goal is to raise at least $25,000, the more money we raise, the more product we'll be able to produce and promote. Together we can help prevent drunk driving accidents!

--------

Breathometer’s device + mobile app transforms your smartphone into a breathalyzer.

CBS News: “Not only to prevent accidents and save lives but avoid serious legal trouble”  
 
C|NET: “I fully support any technology that can help prevent (such) tragedies” 
 
Engadget: “…Phone users keep alcohol in check from a keychain”  
 
Gizmodo: “A whole lot cheaper than a DUI... It looks insanely simple and it fits right in your pocket” 
 
LA Times: “A new device you might not want to blow off.” 
 
Mashable: “It's to help everyone make safe, responsible decisions.” 
 
MSN: “The device that plugs into your phone is small and fits on a keychain--so handy!--so it can be with you any time you, or someone you're with, decides to have a cocktail...” 
 
VentureBeat: “Before you get into a car to drive, it’s probably a good idea to know whether you’re drunk.”
 

Breathometer™ is The World’s First Smartphone Breathalyzer! While designing Breathometer, we strove to create a sleek product that blends seamlessly into your everyday life. Built with your lifestyle in mind, the device has a compact design that fits into the palm of your hand and easily on a keychain.

Drink Smarter with Breathometer

Have you known anyone to be in a situation where a driver has had a drink or two? According to our poll on sodahead.com, 64% of respondents indicated that either they have driven or have been in a car with a driver under the influence.  

By using Breathometer, you now have the ability to help prevent accidents. We’re also building some other amazing features like a push of a button cab service.

How Does It Work?

The Breathometer device connects to your iPhone or Android device via the audio jack. Setting up Breathometer is easy. Download the app, connect the device and blow.

Compatibility
 • iPhone or iPod running iOS 5 or above.
 • Android devices running OS 2.3 or above.

The Power of Knowledge

Breathometer is the next generation breathalyzer that provides an accurate BAC measurement that enables smarter decisions.

Track Your Progress

Breathometer securely tracks your activity to make sure your Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) is heading in the right direction. It tracks your past results so you can be sure to allow for the proper amount of time to pass before you think about getting behind the wheel.

Where We're At

We’ve been developing the smartphone breathalyzer for the past 6 months now and are at a stage where we need your help. The Breathometer device that you see in the video is a real, working prototype but innovation is costly.

While we're close to entering production, your support will help fund: 
• Production tooling 
•  Large component order
• Support marketing efforts and raise awareness

Together, with your support, we can help prevent accidents and potentially save lives! 

Help bring Breathometer to life!

 

**********

FAQs:

1. Can we ship internationally? Yes! Please add $20 USD to your pledge for international shipping.

2. Can I change my shipping address if I move? Yes, we will reach out to everyone 30 days prior to shipping your device to confirm your address and make any necessary changes. Message us if your email changes, as we'll be using that to contact you.

3. I picked a perk with a color choice. How do I make my selection? We'll email you when it's time to ship to pick a color of your choice.

4. I have a question and need to talk to someone about my pledge. Feel free to contact us at support@breathometer.com. We'll do our best to respond within 3 business days.
 
5. What is the level of accuracy and how often do I need to calibrate the device? Calibration and accuracy are two of the most important issues we're working hard on in our final versions of the product. We won't release a product until we feel it meets our high expectations of what consumers want and need.
 
6. Will you be FDA approved? We intend to ship devices subject to FDA approval.
 
7. How do I add $20 (USD) international shipping? If you've already made a pledge, please hit the 'Contribute Now' button and add your shipping fee. Use the same email address you used to pledge so we can match the payment during fulfillment. Sorry for the additional step required but we're super excited to bring this product to international markets.

4. I have a question and need to talk to someone about my pledge. Feel free to contact us at support@breathometer.com. We'll do our best to respond within 3 business days.

We won't release a product until we feel it meets our high expectations of what consumers want and need.
 

6. Will you be FDA approved? We intend to ship devices subject to FDA approval.
 

7. How do I add $20 (USD) international shipping? If you've already made a pledge, please hit the 'Contribute Now' button and add your shipping fee. Use the same email address you used to pledge so we can match the payment during fulfillment. Sorry for the additional step required but we're super excited to bring this product to international markets.

story:
ABOUT FIND’EM TRACKING

Find'em Tracking Team consists of an electronic engineer, mechanical designer, and hardware and software developers. Due to our team member’s military background and experience in commercial and global brand projects, we have the versatility to make the most precise Bluetooth tracking technology, while also achieving the world's thinnest loss prevention device.

WHY USE FIND’EM TRACKING?

 This is a solution to a problem that people face in their daily lives. Leaving your valuables behind is a common human error, and can be avoided using our technology. Our FREE Find'em Tracking App will allow you to set the distance between 5 to a maximum of 200 feet distance. Once your Find'em card goes out of range, you will receive an instant alert on your Smartphone. You can locate your valuables using our precise Radar Technology, and even use Google Maps to find the last location once out of range.

FIND’EM TRACKING FEATURES:

 

  1. Instant Loss-Prevention Alert – Set the distance 5-200 feet and get an instant alert once out of range
  2. Reverse Tracking – If you can’t find your phone, your Find’em Tracking card has a button to make your phone ring
  3. Find’em Tracking Radar – Our precise Radar will indicate the radius between you and valuables and guide you to find them
  4. Google Maps GPS – If you didn’t hear your alert, or for any other reason you notice your wallet is not within tracking distance, use Google integrated Maps to find last specific GPS location


FIND’EM TRACKING SPECS:

  • Size and dimensions – 85mm x 52mm x 2.4mm (thickness of 2 credit cards put together)
  • Colour – Jet Black and White
  • Weight- 15g
  • Power Battery Life – 24-36 month’s
  • Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy
  • Distance Range – 200 FT
  • Software Language – English, Spanish, Russian, French
  • Smartphone – Ipad’s, Iphone 4S, Iphone 5, Samsung Galaxy S3, Samsung Galaxy S4

 

 

 

DOWNLOAD OUR APP IN THE APP STORE & GOOGLE PLAY

        

 

SCHEDULE:

December-June – Planning, hardware and software design & development, Application Development & Testing

June/July – IndieGoGo Campaign and Perfecting Product

July/August – Manufacturing

September – Delivery

 

YOUR HELP!

By funding this project you will help us perfect the product and let the world enjoy the thinnest loss prevention device. If you have any questions or suggestions you can e-mail us at info@findemtracking.com

                                   

FAQ

- How does the Find’em Tracking card work?

Place the card in your wallet, purpose, or other valuables and calibrate the product with the Find’em Tracking App and set the distance

- Will it fit in my wallet?

Yes, the card was specifically designed like a credit card so you can fit it in any standard wallet or purse slot.

- How long does the battery last?

The battery will last for 24-36 month.

- What is the range of the Find’em Tracking card?

The range is up to 200 FT.

- What phones and tablets work with the application?

Ipad’s, Iphone 4S, Iphone 5, Samsung Galaxy S3, Samsung Galaxy S4

- What if I can’t find my smartphone?

Use the reverse tracking technology to alert your phone by pressing the button on the Find’em Tracking card
