story:
What is it?

DO NOT USE THIS BITCOIN ADDRESS - I DID NOT KEEP THE KEY. Indiegogo does not support Bitcoin.

 

MyBTC.cc is the world's first true cryptocurrency transaction card. This will start off for Bitcoin but it has no inherit limits. This product will be open-source, decentralized, and completely flexible for any need. This card will not convert coins to legal tender to be transacted but will create an entirely new network. It will securely send cryptocurrencies from point-to-point. It will do so with a simple composite card with a magnetic stripe - just like your credit card.

Problems this card solves:

  • Online Wallet Security
  • Integration with existing card based transaction systems
  • Simplify the whole process of accepting coins without understanding all the details
  • Eliminate personnel training for cryptocurrency transactions. Replace your POS machine, configure your coin recipient address and existing merchant gateway settings, and you are ready to accept cryptocurrency as well as existing credit cards!

This system is focused on two goals: decentralized card transactions and security.

How to hatch the chicken and the egg..at the same time!

The problem with creating a new transaction network is the card is useless without the merchant and the merchant has no reason to invest in the network before people have cards. To solve this problem we are going to open the entire system up to everyone. Anyone will be able to print/encode cards, offer secure PITA hosting, and sell POS equipment based on our product selections and code. No one will own this network or control it. It will be possible for you to buy a computer, install the PITAS Provider OS, print your own card, encode it, initialize a PITA on your own system, enroll the card you just made on the PITA you just created on your own system, and walk to the nearest merchant accepting MyBTC.cc cards and have the transaction processed SECURELY. All without contacting a single outside server until you swipe the card! No one, besides you (and sometimes not even you), will know where your PITA is or where your coin is stored - NOT EVEN MyBTC.cc!

In order to do this our design relies on numerous of the most secure encryption technologies to date! Technologies like:

  • Tor - The Onion Router
  • Elliptic curve Diffie–Hellman 521-bit encryption on the card
  • Self managed virtual machine hypervisors that cannot be accessed by people.

Changing the World

Our goal with this system is to give control on the transaction system back to the people. In this way, the system mimics Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency networks and designs.

  • No one will be able to bar or ban which merchants accept the payments
  • There will be no tracking of the system besides the blockchain and public markets.
  • All source will be vetted and security ensured. This will be the card someone can use to go to a car dealership and buy a new car with it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't buy a card now for $10 does not mean you can't help the cause!

  • Tell your family and friends about the new card, and
  • Share this campaign on all your favorite social media!

The remainder of this document is for the technically minded but please heed these words..

I don't mind saying, with what I am about to tell you, you could build this system yourself. That's ok. That is why it will all be open source. Just remember, if the people with the ideas and the right motives are not allowed to succeed then you will have limited yourself to the current reality. I was born in the United States in 1982. I have lived here my entire life. Compared to most of the world I have nothing to complain about, until recently, but that does not mean that things cannot improve. Remember, while things can always get worse, they can always get better too. The difference between the two outcomes is entirely subsequent your choices. The following image is of my copyright. My hope is that you will demand this logo on your card:

System Modular Break-down

This system is composed of modular components. Nothing is trusted. Trust is for you to decide whom to endow. Those components are:

  1. You - Undefined
  2. Processor - Simple man in the middle. This is me. If you like this design, I ask you to trust me. I know nothing of your business and do not need to. Think of me as the mail man. I basically decode the card and relay the transaction to your PITA over Tor.
  3. Issuer - This is the module that prints the cards. I will do this for you but I am not your only choice. You can even do this yourself if financial security outweighs the cost of the card printer. You can also be your own issuer with the purchase of a magnetic card encoder and any existing card including a gift card from your local favorite merchant.
  4. Merchant - This is the hardware at the store that you swipe the card into.
  5. Market Place - This is a secure and anonymous place to purchase cards, PITAS, and other services.
  6. Provider - This is the PITA ISP. This is the secure environment I am creating for your wallet to be online all the time. This can be anyone, me, current ISPs, or even yourself. You know - if you are not eager to trust others. Funds are never pooled. Data is never pooled. If the system were hacked they would have to hack each PITA. They would never get everyone's coins.
  7. PITAS - The easiest way to put this is it is your own private bank. Read more about it below!

You

You are the card insofar as the system is concerned. The card has no limitations. Design it with as much or as little information as you care to. The back of the card will have a recommended standard for ease of use. Feel free to ignore it completely.

Here is an example what is encoded on the card:

TRACK 1: OOAK7MOP5QWKJEQFYA2YRV2FCA^JENSEN/JASON A^8870264803297193

TRACK 2: 8870264803297193=12081400000000096013

8870264803297193 is the card number. JENSEN/JASON A is the card holder name - which is optional or can be fake. It is also my name.

120814 is the date the card was issued. So far all this is standard stuff.

OOAK7MOP5QWKJEQFYA2YRV2FCA is the magic. This is the security blanket and the innovation. Well that plus 096013. The big long string is an ECDH 521 bit encryped representation of a Tor Hidden Service. If you are not familiar you should look here:  Tor: Hidden Service Protocol . Without the encryption Tor offers a very secure and anonymous network in which to communicate. But we take that Tor hidden service address and encrypt it to the Public Key of the Processor (that'd be me! I hope) The reason for this is simple. If you have an accessible machine, then people can try to take a crack at opening it. By encrypting it to me you ensure that only I will ever attempt to connect to it and by using Tor I will know nothing about it. 096013 is the initialization vector from a published common dataset. An Initialization Vector is just a way of preventing encoding 1 bit of data 2 times with 1 key from having the same ciphertext.

Processor

The processor's job is pretty simple but really important. The processor is the only one that can know the Tor Hidden Service address. That means no one can attempt to attack or crack your PITA. But the Processor only has these pieces of information:

  1. The Initialization Vector Common Database - this will be published anyways
  2. The Public Key to all the cards - this will be published anyways.
  3. The Private Key to all the cards
  4. A database of Tor to hand entered card numbers (this is completely optional but useful for hardware failures - you can change this at anytime without modifying the card!)
  5. Market Data

I do not even have a database of the secure tor addresses - remember that is stored on the card! Worst case scenario I loose the private key and all the cards need to be re-encoded (you just swipe the card with a $175 machine!). Nobody gets a dime..

Issuer

The issuer prints and mails the cards. This can be anyone who can afford a card printer that can print front and back. The issuer program will automatically take orders from the Market Place as well as have a hand enter batch system. The best way to think of this module is as a new type of miner. Unlike the network miners this miner will have real physical outputs. It will also require labor.

Paper Folder Module 


Card Printer 


Market Place

A simple place to buy and sell services, securely and anonymously (well your address will be required to mail your card to you but my hope is card will be for sale at malls and stores around the world!). This will be part of the Processor module in implementation.

Provider

This is where the real magic happens. We turned a standard Linux box into a unmanaged black box system. You can not even set the IP address on the system it requires DHCP, there are no valid logins, and it does not accept inbound connections. It uses Tor for everything and enforces that all PITAS do as well. It requires that it builds all the partitions and checks every file's signature. It also creates the whole hypervisor environment and spins up as many PITAS as the hardware can support. It creates one internal network. It also spins up a few key Virtual Machines (VMs) that have specific functions. One is the Swarm Exit Node. It is a Tor Router Middle Box. All routing it does is over Tor. All other VMs are attached to the internal network only. Swarm Manage is responsible for managing all the VM instances. No one can access it either. The only configuration it has is your company name, your payment address, and your hourly rate for leasing the service. This is also a new type of miner. You provide a service, that requires computer resources, and in turn get paid for it. It, however, requires a different type of hardware then a traditional miner. There will also never be an equivalent of a ASIC. It also does not "create" coins.

The Provider uses a Copy On Write Filesystem (COW hehe) [BTRFS] to limit the amount of replication of the blockchain. Without getting too complicated, a COW file system can clone an entire hard drive in almost no time for use by another system. This way all the PITAS use the same hard drive space for the same blockchain. Each night the system reconciles all the PITAS back into a common clone. This is all done in the Swarm Data VM. To use real world numbers, I am hoping to put upwards of 250 PITAS on one system. If each one required the a copy of the blockchain that would require around 4.2TB with a blockchain size of 17GB. By using a COW file system this is reduced to just 17GB+(Number of PITAS * Daily Blockchain Growth). To provide America with this system, assuming 150 million "households", that would require about 2.5 Zettabytes. What is worse is this would be the exact same data. However, this system will still require hundreds of thousands of servers.

PITAS

The PITAS. It's the cutesy name I came up with. It stands for Personal Information Transaction Authorization System. It actually fits. It's clever too. But the acronym was reverse engineered to make you think of food. It's sole purpose is to protect your money- your coin- your savings.

But it is basically a virtual machine.

Bottom line is you configure it. It receives the transaction request, then follows the rules you setup to get authorization. This makes the card worthless without the ability to confirm the transaction. The PITAS can use text messages, phone calls, and two factor authentication schemes to approve a transaction. You will have complete control.

Here is a design diagram.

The file system is a clone of an image. On top of that during boot the system sets up an encrypted partition using a random key (/dev/urandom). Think of it as a single boot computer. You turn it on, set it up, when it reboots or looses power everything is gone. Don't worry though! All your data is stored encrypted on a decentralized store. Actually it is a lot like Blockchain.info but instead of using a browser I wanted to use a whole computer. But for practicality I used virtual machines. The fault with this is that VMs rely on the security of the hypervisor for security. That is why no one can login to the Provider.

On top of this it has Tor installed. This is how all communications take place. The PITAS will have firewall rules that do not let incoming connections and there are no logins. Finally the screen will most likely just display a big happy face.

The process of how this all takes place is a bit convoluted but, basically the system starts, uses DHCP to get an IP address, connects to the Swarm Manage VM once to get a Unique Identifier. This UID will represent the whole ISP not the computer it resides on. It then generates a Tor Hidden Service Address. It connects to the Processor and posts it's availability. Once you pay for it with coin, it will send you the Tor address, from there you initialize it, install your wallet, and enroll your cards. I am leaving some details out but nothing is rocket science. Basically the Provider will never know what system your PITAS is on but will still get paid for the service.

Merchant 

For our prototype purposes we are choosing the bulk of the hardware from market standard equipment in predominately Asian markets. If this decision perplexes you, please look at your printer, fax, or just about any other Western world product. They are encumbered with End User Licensing Agreements and other legal restrictions - all of which are subject to change at any time. The products, specifically from China, have a very lax policy on use, pay cash get the goods, and you own the things you buy. Unlike say the FruitCompany [hint-hint] that sells the NotYourPhone (yPhone) that it is actually illegal for you to modify the software and run what you choose on the device. This same company just recently tried to deal bitcoin a blow by removing all the wallet software from the yNoise market.

Simple POS Terminal (PERK)

This simple POS terminal has an encrypted keypad, IC card, Mifare reader, Magnetic Stripe Reader, and a Thermal Printer. For connection options it has WIFI, and 2/3G CDMA/GSM Modems. It also includes a battery which is standard.


POS Terminal (PERK)

This is a full computer. It can run Linux or Windows. As I am targeting the majority of users the prototype will most likely run Windows. It comes with a 15" LCD touch screen, thermal printer, cash drawer, 2x20 Customer Display, Magnetic Card Reader (encrypted), and a barcode scanner.


Mobile Terminal (PERK)


The Mobile Terminal is a 1ghz, 2200mah Android or Windows CE mobile workstation with WiFi, Bluetooth, IC, RFID, Magnetic Card Reader, and a Printer. Options include 2D barcode scanner, GSM/GPRS modem, Camera, and/or GPS. This system would be great for returants so you could swipe their card right at the table instead of making your customer wait, car dealerships, mobile businesses and trade shows, and, finally, it can be used to update inventory in your store.

We are currently having quality control issues with this product. We still hope to offer it but as of right now we couldn't guarantee a product. Therefore, we are looking for a replacement but may not be able to find a comparable device. If you would have liked to buy this device you should contact Urovo and tell them to get their product organized. Email info@urovo.com.

MyPITAS Appliance (PERK)


This is a very special micro platform. It comes with a U640 Intel CPU capable of doing the virtualization instructions for Virtual Machines, 500GB hard drive or 64GB SSD, 4GB ram, 1 HDMI (if you want to re-task it), by default it will run the Provider OS. Again, your PITA would be on this box, where ever you put it since by using Tor it easily bypasses firewalls, and this is where you wallet could reside if you do not trust any ISP. It is also very inexpensive.
story_txt:
What is it?DO NOT USE THIS BITCOIN ADDRESS - I DID NOT KEEP THE KEY. Indiegogo does not support Bitcoin. MyBTC.cc is the world's first true cryptocurrency transaction card. This will start off for Bitcoin but it has no inherit limits. This product will be open-source, decentralized, and completely flexible for any need. This card will not convert coins to legal tender to be transacted but will create an entirely new network. It will securely send cryptocurrencies from point-to-point. It will do so with a simple composite card with a magnetic stripe - just like your credit card.Problems this card solves:
Online Wallet Security
Integration with existing card based transaction systems
Simplify the whole process of accepting coins without understanding all the details
Eliminate personnel training for cryptocurrency transactions. Replace your POS machine, configure your coin recipient address and existing merchant gateway settings, and you are ready to accept cryptocurrency as well as existing credit cards!
This system is focused on two goals: decentralized card transactions and security.How to hatch the chicken and the egg..at the same time!The problem with creating a new transaction network is the card is useless without the merchant and the merchant has no reason to invest in the network before people have cards. To solve this problem we are going to open the entire system up to everyone. Anyone will be able to print/encode cards, offer secure PITA hosting, and sell POS equipment based on our product selections and code. No one will own this network or control it. It will be possible for you to buy a computer, install the PITAS Provider OS, print your own card, encode it, initialize a PITA on your own system, enroll the card you just made on the PITA you just created on your own system, and walk to the nearest merchant accepting MyBTC.cc cards and have the transaction processed SECURELY. All without contacting a single outside server until you swipe the card! No one, besides you (and sometimes not even you), will know where your PITA is or where your coin is stored - NOT EVEN MyBTC.cc!In order to do this our design relies on numerous of the most secure encryption technologies to date! Technologies like:
Tor - The Onion Router
Elliptic curve Diffie–Hellman 521-bit encryption on the card
Self managed virtual machine hypervisors that cannot be accessed by people.
Changing the WorldOur goal with this system is to give control on the transaction system back to the people. In this way, the system mimics Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency networks and designs.
No one will be able to bar or ban which merchants accept the payments
There will be no tracking of the system besides the blockchain and public markets.
All source will be vetted and security ensured. This will be the card someone can use to go to a car dealership and buy a new car with it.
Other Ways You Can HelpJust because you can't buy a card now for $10 does not mean you can't help the cause!
Tell your family and friends about the new card, and
Share this campaign on all your favorite social media!
The remainder of this document is for the technically minded but please heed these words..I don't mind saying, with what I am about to tell you, you could build this system yourself. That's ok. That is why it will all be open source. Just remember, if the people with the ideas and the right motives are not allowed to succeed then you will have limited yourself to the current reality. I was born in the United States in 1982. I have lived here my entire life. Compared to most of the world I have nothing to complain about, until recently, but that does not mean that things cannot improve. Remember, while things can always get worse, they can always get better too. The difference between the two outcomes is entirely subsequent your choices. The following image is of my copyright. My hope is that you will demand this logo on your card:System Modular Break-downThis system is composed of modular components. Nothing is trusted. Trust is for you to decide whom to endow. Those components are:
You - Undefined
Processor - Simple man in the middle. This is me. If you like this design, I ask you to trust me. I know nothing of your business and do not need to. Think of me as the mail man. I basically decode the card and relay the transaction to your PITA over Tor.
Issuer - This is the module that prints the cards. I will do this for you but I am not your only choice. You can even do this yourself if financial security outweighs the cost of the card printer. You can also be your own issuer with the purchase of a magnetic card encoder and any existing card including a gift card from your local favorite merchant.
Merchant - This is the hardware at the store that you swipe the card into.
Market Place - This is a secure and anonymous place to purchase cards, PITAS, and other services.
Provider - This is the PITA ISP. This is the secure environment I am creating for your wallet to be online all the time. This can be anyone, me, current ISPs, or even yourself. You know - if you are not eager to trust others. Funds are never pooled. Data is never pooled. If the system were hacked they would have to hack each PITA. They would never get everyone's coins.
PITAS - The easiest way to put this is it is your own private bank. Read more about it below!
YouYou are the card insofar as the system is concerned. The card has no limitations. Design it with as much or as little information as you care to. The back of the card will have a recommended standard for ease of use. Feel free to ignore it completely.Here is an example what is encoded on the card:TRACK 1: OOAK7MOP5QWKJEQFYA2YRV2FCA^JENSEN/JASON
A^8870264803297193TRACK 2: 8870264803297193=120814000000000960138870264803297193 is the card number. JENSEN/JASON A is the card holder name - which is optional or can be fake. It is also my name.120814 is the date the card was issued. So far all this is standard stuff.OOAK7MOP5QWKJEQFYA2YRV2FCA is the magic. This is the security blanket and the innovation. Well that plus 096013. The big long string is an ECDH 521 bit encryped representation of a Tor Hidden Service. If you are not familiar you should look here:  Tor: Hidden Service Protocol . Without the encryption Tor offers a very secure and anonymous network in which to communicate. But we take that Tor hidden service address and encrypt it to the Public Key of the Processor (that'd be me! I hope) The reason for this is simple. If you have an accessible machine, then people can try to take a crack at opening it. By encrypting it to me you ensure that only I will ever attempt to connect to it and by using Tor I will know nothing about it. 096013 is the initialization vector from a published common dataset. An Initialization Vector is just a way of preventing encoding 1 bit of data 2 times with 1 key from having the same ciphertext.ProcessorThe processor's job is pretty simple but really important. The processor is the only one that can know the Tor Hidden Service address. That means no one can attempt to attack or crack your PITA. But the Processor only has these pieces of information:
The Initialization Vector Common Database - this will be published anyways
The Public Key to all the cards - this will be published anyways.
The Private Key to all the cards
A database of Tor to hand entered card numbers (this is completely optional but useful for hardware failures - you can change this at anytime without modifying the card!)
Market Data
I do not even have a database of the secure tor addresses - remember that is stored on the card! Worst case scenario I loose the private key and all the cards need to be re-encoded (you just swipe the card with a $175 machine!). Nobody gets a dime..IssuerThe issuer prints and mails the cards. This can be anyone who can afford a card printer that can print front and back. The issuer program will automatically take orders from the Market Place as well as have a hand enter batch system. The best way to think of this module is as a new type of miner. Unlike the network miners this miner will have real physical outputs. It will also require labor.Paper Folder Module Card Printer Market PlaceA simple place to buy and sell services, securely and anonymously (well your address will be required to mail your card to you but my hope is card will be for sale at malls and stores around the world!). This will be part of the Processor module in implementation.ProviderThis is where the real magic happens. We turned a standard Linux box into a unmanaged black box system. You can not even set the IP address on the system it requires DHCP, there are no valid logins, and it does not accept inbound connections. It uses Tor for everything and enforces that all PITAS do as well. It requires that it builds all the partitions and checks every file's signature. It also creates the whole hypervisor environment and spins up as many PITAS as the hardware can support. It creates one internal network. It also spins up a few key Virtual Machines (VMs) that have specific functions. One is the Swarm Exit Node. It is a Tor Router Middle Box. All routing it does is over Tor. All other VMs are attached to the internal network only. Swarm Manage is responsible for managing all the VM instances. No one can access it either. The only configuration it has is your company name, your payment address, and your hourly rate for leasing the service. This is also a new type of miner. You provide a service, that requires computer resources, and in turn get paid for it. It, however, requires a different type of hardware then a traditional miner. There will also never be an equivalent of a ASIC. It also does not "create" coins.The Provider uses a Copy On Write Filesystem (COW hehe) [BTRFS] to limit the amount of replication of the blockchain. Without getting too complicated, a COW file system can clone an entire hard drive in almost no time for use by another system. This way all the PITAS use the same hard drive space for the same blockchain. Each night the system reconciles all the PITAS back into a common clone. This is all done in the Swarm Data VM. To use real world numbers, I am hoping to put upwards of 250 PITAS on one system. If each one required the a copy of the blockchain that would require around 4.2TB with a blockchain size of 17GB. By using a COW file system this is reduced to just 17GB+(Number of PITAS * Daily Blockchain Growth). To provide America with this system, assuming 150 million "households", that would require about 2.5 Zettabytes. What is worse is this would be the exact same data. However, this system will still require hundreds of thousands of servers.PITASThe PITAS. It's the cutesy name I came up with. It stands for Personal Information Transaction Authorization System. It actually fits. It's clever too. But the acronym was reverse engineered to make you think of food. It's sole purpose is to protect your money- your coin- your savings.But it is basically a virtual machine.Bottom line is you configure it. It receives the transaction request, then follows the rules you setup to get authorization. This makes the card worthless without the ability to confirm the transaction. The PITAS can use text messages, phone calls, and two factor authentication schemes to approve a transaction. You will have complete control.Here is a design diagram.The file system is a clone of an image. On top of that during boot the system sets up an encrypted partition using a random key (/dev/urandom). Think of it as a single boot computer. You turn it on, set it up, when it reboots or looses power everything is gone. Don't worry though! All your data is stored encrypted on a decentralized store. This is how all communications take place. The PITAS will have firewall rules that do not let incoming connections and there are no logins. Finally the screen will most likely just display a big happy face.The process of how this all takes place is a bit convoluted but, basically the system starts, uses DHCP to get an IP address, connects to the Swarm Manage VM once to get a Unique Identifier. This UID will represent the whole ISP not the computer it resides on. It then generates a Tor Hidden Service Address. It connects to the Processor and posts it's availability. Once you pay for it with coin, it will send you the Tor address, from there you initialize it, install your wallet, and enroll your cards. I am leaving some details out but nothing is rocket science. Basically the Provider will never know what system your PITAS is on but will still get paid for the service.Merchant For our prototype purposes we are choosing the bulk of the hardware from market standard equipment in predominately Asian markets. If this decision perplexes you, please look at your printer, fax, or just about any other Western world product. They are encumbered with End User Licensing Agreements and other legal restrictions - all of which are subject to change at any time. The products, specifically from China, have a very lax policy on use, pay cash get the goods, and you own the things you buy. Unlike say the FruitCompany [hint-hint] that sells the NotYourPhone (yPhone) that it is actually illegal for you to modify the software and run what you choose on the device. This same company just recently tried to deal bitcoin a blow by removing all the wallet software from the yNoise market.Simple POS Terminal (PERK)This simple POS terminal has an encrypted keypad, IC card, Mifare reader, Magnetic Stripe Reader, and a Thermal Printer. For connection options it has WIFI, and 2/3G CDMA/GSM Modems. It also includes a battery which is standard.POS Terminal (PERK)This is a full computer. It can run Linux or Windows. As I am targeting the majority of users the prototype will most likely run Windows. It comes with a 15" LCD touch screen, thermal printer, cash drawer, 2x20 Customer Display, Magnetic Card Reader (encrypted), and a barcode scanner.
Mobile Terminal (PERK)The Mobile Terminal is a 1ghz, 2200mah Android or Windows CE mobile workstation with WiFi, Bluetooth, IC, RFID, Magnetic Card Reader, and a Printer. Options include 2D barcode scanner, GSM/GPRS modem, Camera, and/or GPS. If you would have liked to buy this device you should contact Urovo and tell them to get their product organized. Email info@urovo.com.MyPITAS Appliance (PERK)This is a very special micro platform. story:
Holiday Panes tells the behind the scenes story of one of New York City’s greatest holiday treasures, The Holiday Department Store Window. Some are elaborate mechanical stage performances from famous works of art and others are fancy displays of the must have items that everyone wants.

Holiday Panes talks with the people who design and build the windows. NYC Media, New York’s Public Broadcasting Channel gave us the green light to produce four 2 minute segments that each tells its own behind the scene story; What makes a great holiday window display, how long it takes to design and build them, how have the windows changed overtime and the windows as a marketing tool.

Producing for PBS is great, but they only distribute programming they don’t pay for the production. Placement Productions is asking for your help in offsetting some of the costs that we have incurred in telling these fun stories.

story:
We are the Burlingame High School Iron Panthers, a rookie robotics team competing in our first ever FRC season. We need $5000 to pay the registration fee for the 2014 FRC Sacramento Regional hosted at UC Davis.

The team’s mission is to enrich the student mind at Burlingame High School. We aim to bring together the student body through a shared passion for robotics and technology. We are committed to creating a welcoming environment for anyone to work his/her hardest while learning practical skills. We also hope to continuously improve our robotics program and gradually move our way up in various robotics competitions.

The video above documents our first FTC qualifying competition. As the video shows, our first competition ended with a broken robot. However, we rallied and redesigned the robot for our second FTC competition, at which we were the highest scoring team. The second seeded team chose us for an alliance that took third place at the competition. We hope to achieve comparable success in the FRC competition.

Through robotics, we've learned not only practical engineering and programming skills, but also the importance of iterative design, unflagging spirit, and nerves of steel. We hope that by competing in the Sacramento Regional, we will be able to test our limits and bring STEM endeavors to greater prominence at our school and in our communities.

If we do not reach our entire goal of $5000, we will still be able to use the money we do raise in order to buy needed parts for the robot.

If you aren't able to contribute any money at the moment, please share our campaign with others who may be able to do so. Help us spread the word!

Check us out on Facebook, YouTube and our website!

https://www.facebook.com/ironpanthers

http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtumX6DGAKybCU7G5BuKyEQ

http://burlingamerobotics.com/

Check out our Prezi for more information!

http://prezi.com/jkgenwbyud1w/burlingame-robotics-team/
